description:
Draughts is a 1-player-versus-computer checkers game.

Can play regular checkers or Blitz Draughts, where a move must be made within 10 seconds or a piece is lost. There are six levels of computer difficulty, and movement is made by typing in the piece to move and the desired location.
title: Draughts

description:
The Wizard's Challenge is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Deposited in another realm by a wizard, the player must gather 12 treasures and bring them to the wizard in order to return home again. These treasures include: a sapphire, a painting, a robe, a crown, a scepter, jewelry, pearls, an emerald, a gold ingot, a necklace, and a trophy. The player explores a large school and the surrounding area.

They must outsmart bullies, learn secret passwords, deal with teachers, and avoid other dangers. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature.
title: The Wizard's Challenge

description: In Antkiller the player's task is to eliminate all the ants on the board. The player has only four arrows and if they exhaust them, they have to return to their base for more. The game also features a caterpillar that will fall after two hits.
title: Antkiller

description:
Cosmic Combat is a 2-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Two players control a small tank that can rotate, accelerate, and fire directly forwards. The two combatants maneuver around six different courses trying to shoot their enemy. If either player touches an object or gets shot, their opponent gains a point. Players can choose shot length and whether each level has a border.
title: Cosmic Combat

description:
Nemesis is a 1-player Centipede clone for the BBC Micro.

From the depths of space come Earth's deadliest adversaries, the Vogons. The player controls a small character who moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, can move upwards a short distance, firing directly forwards. The Vogons approach from the top of the screen, and will move down a line and change direction if they are shot or hit an object.

The goal each level is to destroy all the Vogons. If the player shoots an asteroid it begins to fall towards the player, but can be shot again to be destroyed. Chargers fall directly towards the player, while Crushers bounce about the bottom of the screen. Crawlers move laterally across the screen and leave warp vectors, which will move any Vogon in contact to the bottom of the screen. The player starts with three lives.
title: Nemesis

description:
Blockbuster is a 1-player Q*Bert clone for the BBC Micro.

Buster hops about the blocks trying to turn them all red, but will fall off the blocks if not careful. As Buster moves, he must avoid guano-dropping birds, bouncing green blobs, and the wolf who continually chases the player. The player can hop on a floating colored disc to lure the wolf to his death. Small red creatures leave carrots for Buster to collect. After changing the color of all blocks the player moves to the next level.
title: Blockbuster

description:
Space Jailer is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The nine Argon kings of the Argon Empire have been imprisoned in space jail. As jailer, the player controls a ship at the bottom of the the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. Argons come from both sides of the screen trying to free their king by removing blocks from the prison.

If the Argons reach an imprisoned king and bring them to the side of the screen they are freed. The player tries to shoot the Argons to prevent them from doing this. The Argons and their spaceships return fire, and the player loses a life if hit.

A level is completed if all Argons are destroyed. The player loses a life if hit, and if all kings on a level are freed or a total of nine kings are freed over several levels, then it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: They Move a Little Faster on Level 3

title: Space Jailer

description:
Martian Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is in command of the only defenses on the Red Planet. The screen display represents the view through the sights in the cramped confines of a solitary laser post. The player must sweep the skies above the city to protect it against the invading Zargons.

Enemy ships come from the left, and the player must shoot them down before they can bombard the city. If a Zargon is missed, it re-approaches from the right while the next ship approaches from the left. A single hit, and the city is reduced to rubble.

The player can erect a short-lived force field to protect the city, but the energy is rapidly depleted and only recharges slowly. If the city is destroyed three times, it's game over.
title: Martian Attack

description:
Zarm is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is commander of the ZARM craft, which is trying to land on a planet's surface in order to collect five survivors. Numerous obstacles move horizontally across the screen. The mother ship moves laterally across the top of the screen, and the player times their exit. The player then controls their ship left and right, as well as vertical thrust, as gravity constantly pulls the ship downwards.

They must slowly land on one of the four landing pads without hitting any dangers to load a single survivor. The player must then head to the awaiting mothership while avoiding the many new dangers. This needs to be repeated five times to rescue all five survivors. The player starts with three ships.
title: Zarm

description:
Hell Driver is a 1-player top-down arcade driving game for the BBC Micro.

The player drivers their yellow car through a large scrolling city trying to run over all of the flags. A map shows the player and the flags' locations. The player can turn at intersections and accelerate or decelerate. The player has limited fuel, and can refuel at fuel pumps. If the car overfills it catches on fire.

When all flags are collected the player moves to a higher difficulty level, where obstacles like fire engines, police cars, rocks, and ice patches begin to appear. If the player hits an obstacle they move to a lower level. Fire engines do not follow the player. Police cars follow the player and can be stopped by firing smoke at the cost of fuel. The player cannot turn while on ice.
title: Hell Driver

description:
Seek is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Set in the foothills of the Ambigial mountain on the border between Austria and Germany, the player must search the surrounding countryside for seven hidden treasures of great value. These must be brought back to the clearing at the crossroads.

Places to explore include a castle, a crypt, and the mines. Dangers include deadly swamps, falls from great height, and goblins. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save or restore feature.
title: Seek

description:
Reversi is a conversion of the popular board game for the BBC Micro.

Also known as Othello, the player competes against the computer on an 8 x 8 board. The aim is to fill the board with as many pieces of their own color as possible by flanking the opponent's pieces to capture them and reverse their color.
title: Reversi

description:
Mastermind is a 1–2 player puzzle solving game for the BBC Micro.

Either the computer or human opponent designs a passcode consisting of four spaces and six possible colors. Each turn, the player submits a passcode, and they are told how many pieces are the correct color, and how many are in the correct position. The goal is to solve the puzzle within eight moves.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Solve the Puzzle in 6 Turns.

title: Mastermind

description:
Space Fighter is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship that moves up and down, fires directly forwards, and can temporarily blast ahead to the center of the screen. Enemies appear from the right, and the player is armed with three smart bombs that can destroy all enemies on the screen.

The ship has limited fuel, and can be recharged by blasting fuel dumps. Enemies include: mutants, swarmers, trimorts, baiters, and baryons. The player starts with three ships.
title: Space Fighter

description:
Roulette is a 1–6 player gambling game.

Each player starts with £100, and can bid on red or black for 2-to-1 odds. Players can also bet 1–9, 10–18, 19–27, or 28–36 for 3-to-1 odds. The roulette wheel is animated, and the last remaining person to have money is the winner.
title: Roulette

description: In Wall, the player controls a horizontally-moving paddle at the bottom of the screen, and attempts to break blocks by bouncing a ball into them without letting the ball fall off the bottom of the screen. The player gains a point for every block removed, but loses four points if they miss a ball. If the score falls below zero it's game over. The player can modify paddle width, whether to have a paddle at the top of the screen, five ball speeds, and which bricks score.
title: Wall

description:
Munchyman is an early Pac-Man clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls Munchyman as he tries to eat all the dots in a maze while avoiding the pursuing enemies. Power pellets located in each of the four corners of the maze make enemies temporarily run from the player, as they can be eaten at this time.

If the player is touched by an enemy they restart the level with all the dots replaced. The player starts with three lives.
title: Munchyman

description:
Space Maze is a 1-player maze game for the BBC Micro.

The player is an intrepid adventurer from Earth. Caught in a fierce magnetic storm, they have been forced to crash land in the legendary Labyrinth of Titan. The player navigates from a 1st-person perspective, trying to find the Transmat probe, which will transport the player to the orbiting fleet and safety.

The danger comes from the bloodthirsty Froogs, an ancient species of blood thirsty monsters. If the player encounters a Froog, it's game over. To help the player, they have access to a map, which displays the location of the Transmat and current Froog locations.
title: Space Maze

description:
Zombies is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is on a screen filled with zombies and an equal number of zombie-killing squares. The zombies move straight towards the player, and the player must lure them onto a zombie killing square. If the player is touched by a zombie it's game over.

Zombies speed up as time passes on a level. After killing all zombies, the player enters a new level with one additional zombie.
title: Zombies

description:
Footer is a 2-player soccer game for the BBC Micro.

Each team consists of a single player with the goal of scoring on their opponent's net. Players can move in all directions, shoot, and take the ball from the other player. Players can allow dribbling, which allows running with the ball, or not. Each game lasts 300 seconds, and the team with the most goals wins.
title: Footer

description:
Asteroid Storm is a 1-player Asteroids clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small ship that can rotate left or right, accelerate, and shoot forward. The ship also has the ability to hyperspace, or instantly move randomly about the screen.

Numerous asteroids float about the screen and, when shot, break into two smaller pieces, and then two even smaller pieces, until finally destroyed. Asteroids change trajectory when hit.

Spaceships sometimes appear and shoot towards the player. Both asteroids and the player can move off the edge of the screen and wrap around to the other side. When all asteroid fragments are destroyed the player moves to the next challenge.
title: Asteroid Storm

description:
Laser Command is a 1–2 player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls the target for a laser base at the bottom center of the screen, attempting to shoot down incoming missiles that threaten their cities. The player is also armed with mines that can be placed and then detonated at a later time. If the laser base is destroyed, the player can no longer return fire. This can be rebuilt for a loss of 10 missiles.

At the end of each bombardment the player receives bonus points for remaining cities and laser power. If all cities are destroyed it's game over. There are nine levels of difficulty, and the player can choose to combat dumb or smart bombs. Smart bombs move randomly about the screen. There is also an option for spaceships that appear and fire at the cities.
title: Laser Command

description:
Yahtzee is a 1–6 player implementation of the popular dice game for the BBC Micro.

Players take turns rolling five dice and, on each turn, can choose which dice to keep. The player can reroll the remaining dice for two more rounds, keeping the five dice they prefer before choosing their scoring category. There are 11 scoring categories, which include the sum of all ones to sixes, three of a kind, four of a kind, full house, four dice straight, five dice straight, poker dice (five of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used.
title: Yahtzee

description:
Gomoku is a 1-player-versus-computer board game.

The player and computer opponent take turns placing either an X or an O on a 10 x 10 board. The first player to score five-in-a-row is the winner.
title: Gomoku

description:
Timetrek is a real-time Star Trek variant for the BBC Micro.

The player controls the Enterprise, as they seek out and destroy all Klingon vessels in the galaxy. The galaxy consists of a 7 x 7 quadrant map, and each quadrant is divided into 7 x 7 sectors.

The ship is armed with torpedoes and "phasors". The player has a limited number of torpedoes, but these instantly destroy a Klingon vessel. Phasors use the ship's energy, which is also used to supply shields and power hyperspace jumps between quadrants.

Long range sensors allow locating Klingons and bases in nearby quadrants. Damage control and shield control allow management of ship systems. Bases allow resupply of energy and torpedoes, but these can be destroyed by Klingon vessels.

The player has a total of 30 stardates to defeat all Klingons, and there are 20 levels of difficulty.
title: Timetrek

description:
Star Trek is a turn-based Star Trek variant for the BBC Micro.

The player controls the Enterprise, as they seek out and destroy all Klingon vessels in the galaxy. The number of Klingon vessels, star bases, and days to complete the mission are randomized at the beginning of each session.

The galaxy consists of a 8 x 8 quadrant map, and each quadrant is divided into 8 x 8 sectors. Quadrants can have stars, which are deadly to navigate through, and star bases which allow refill of energy and torpedoes.

The ship is armed with torpedoes and phasers. The player has a limited number of torpedoes, but these instantly destroy a Klingon vessel. Phasers use the ship's energy, which is also used to supply shields and power hyperspace jumps between quadrants. Long range sensors allow locating Klingons in nearby quadrants. Shield control allows management of ship systems.
title: Star Trek

description:
Cat and Mouse is a 1-player arcade maze game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a mouse who starts at the far end of a randomized maze, and must navigate to the exit point while avoiding one or two cats. The cats follow hallways, but randomly take an intersection when they encounter a branch. There are two speed levels for the cats available. If the mouse is caught it's eaten.
title: Cat and Mouse

description:
Astro Navigator is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player must navigate their ship through 11 caves full of sharp twists and dangers from above. The ship constantly moves from left to right, and the player can move up and down, and accelerate or decelerate. The goal is to reach the right of the screen and, if the player hits any obstacles, they restart the level. There are five levels of difficulty, and the player starts with five ships.
title: Astro Navigator

description:
Alien Destroyers is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, trying to blast all of the incoming alien destroyers. The aliens move as a group until they reach the edge of the screen, move down one space, and reverse direction. Spaceships occasionally fly across the top of the screen.

Three large shields offer protection from incoming fire. Aliens' shots often break into many smaller pieces as they close in on the player. If the player is hit they lose a life, and if the aliens reach the bottom of the screen it's game over.
title: Alien Destroyers

description: Maze Invaders is a 1–2 player arcade game where the player must defeat all the monsters in a randomly generated maze. The player controls a small dot that moves in the cardinal directions. Three monsters are placed in the maze, and the player must reach all three in a minimal amount of time and moves. The player loses points when they hit a wall. There are three speeds and three levels of maze difficulty.
title: Maze Invaders

description:
2002 is a 3D space-station docking simulator, where the player tries to successfully dock their space shuttle with the station from a 1st-person perspective under a number of progressively more difficult conditions. These range from within the approach corridor on axis and stable to crashing with HUD and status screen inoperative.

The HUD displays relative velocity compared to the station on three axes, range, overall velocity, and remaining fuel. A nav computer helps with shuttle adjustments.

Wallaby is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

A baby wallaby has been kidnapped by evil monkeys, and the player wallaby must rescue him. The wallaby can move left, right, jump, and climb ladders. It also has a short punch that can knock out monkeys.

The wallaby can only reach platforms on a different level by climbing up or down. If the player jumps to a higher platform they fall through the floor, and if they fall off a platform they die. Monkeys throw and drop apple cores at the player. The player has limited time to complete each level, and receives bonus points by picking up fruit. A bell on each level can be punched to make more fruit appear.
title: Wallaby

description:
Darts is a 2-player darts game consisting of three modes: Five-oh-One, Three-oh-One, and Round the Board. The dart is positioned at the bottom of the screen, and the player holds the throw button to determine the power of the throw.

  • In Five-oh-One, the player starts with a score of 501, and must successfully count down to exactly 0. Each player throws three darts, and must finish on a double.
  • Three-oh-One is similar, but the starting score is 301.
  • In Round the Board, each player must hit each number on the board in turn. However, doubles up to 10 and trebles up to 6 allow numbers to be skipped. After reaching 20, the next target is the first double hit or double 20, and finally the bull.
title: Darts

description: Moon Mission is a 1-player arcade game where the player must safely rescue six stranded survivors on the planet's surface. The player starts in their orbiting vessel, which moves quickly across the top of the screen. The player chooses when to launch and, during descent, can move laterally to avoid asteroids and bombs to safely land on a landing pad. The landing pads get smaller and shorter with each landing. The player has limited fuel to slow their descent over six landings. After picking up the survivor, the player must head to the awaiting mothership. They can move laterally and fire forwards, and must avoid or shoot alien vessels that threaten them. After rescuing six people, the game becomes more difficult with faster and more frequent obstacles.
title: Moon Mission

description: Missile Strike is a 1-player clone of Missile Command for the BBC Micro. The player controls a crosshair to fire a limited number of missiles each round, and must destroy incoming missiles before they can destroy the bases at the bottom of the screen. Satellites, planes, and smart bombs add additional challenge to each level. At the end of each round the player receives a bonus based upon remaining cities and missiles. The player loses missiles if the missile silo in the center of the screen is hit. When all cities are destroyed, it's game over.
title: Missile Strike

description: Neutron is a 1-player-versus-computer light cycle game played from an isometric perspective. The player moves in four directions and leaves a tail behind their vehicle as they drive. The player has limited fuel each round to force their opponent to run into a wall or a tail. If the player crashes they lose a life. Later levels have faster cycles, as well as barricades and other obstacles to avoid. If the player crashes three times it's game over.
title: Neutron

description:
Boris in the Underworld is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Boris has had his home raided by underworld creatures, and they have stolen most of his possessions. This has quite upset Boris, so he delves into the underground to reacquire his belongings. Boris moves in all directions, and can fire in the cardinal directions. On each level, monsters move towards the player, and the fiery walls of the underground approach from the top and bottom. Boris must shoot all the monsters, who take multiple hits to destroy, to make his stolen possession appear. The player must grab this before the walls close in.
title: Boris in the Underworld

description:
Star Warp is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Played from a 1st-person perspective, the player must protect their home world from the incoming alien menace. The player controls a crosshair, and must shoot incoming alien ships. Enemy torpedoes can also downed before reaching the player. If the ship fires too frequently it can overheat, and the player will need time before firing again.

As the player takes damage their shields are depleted, and it's game over if this hits 0. Each level, new and faster-moving enemies approach.
title: Star Warp

description:
Star Striker is a 1-player space-themed arcade game for the BBC Micro. The player uses their three-part spacecraft to destroy incoming alien vessels. The ship moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires directly forward while a number of different enemy vessels appear.

The player starts with the forward-most part of the ship. This is a small vessel with a single gun turret. If this vessel is destroyed, the player will utilize the second part, which is wider and fires two shots at once. Finally, the third and largest part of the craft is used.

Every four stages, the player has the chance to dock their spacecraft with the remaining larger section. This creates a new larger craft with increased firepower. It is possible to crash during the docking sequence, losing a section of the craft. After defeating all stages, the ship pieces again separate.
title: Star Striker

description:
Jack and the Beanstalk is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro. The player controls Jack as he tries to steal bags of gold from the giant in the clouds. Gameplay is divided into two levels: the ground level with Jack's house, and a sky level representing the giant's castle.

There's a beanstalk that grows in the center of the screen beside Jack's house when the weather is rainy. When the sun comes out, caterpillars run along the bottom of the screen and shorten the plant. The player can collect caterpillars and butterflies without damage. If the player jumps and touches the axe it instantly cuts down the plant. The player can collect golden eggs in this section, and must avoid touching the smoke from Jack's chimney.

Jack can climb the complete beanstalk to reach the giant's castle. Here, the giant and deadly snails patrol. The giant moves about randomly until the player picks up gold. Then the giant follows the player and will even chase him to the ground level. Jack must quickly reach the bottom of the beanstalk and cut down the tree before the Giant reaches the bottom. Gold can then be stored at Jack's house while he waits for the plant to regrow. The player can pick up a shovel in the castle to dig holes, which kill snails and slow down giants. The player has limited time to collect as many bags of gold as possible.
title: Jack and the Beanstalk

description: Airlift is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game where the player controls a helicopter and rescues hostages. The helicopter can move in all directions, and can drop bombs if moving slowly, but will fire horizontally when moving faster. Numerous buildings dot the landscape, and these are filled with hostages. Tanks prowl along the ground, and these fire a short distance in the air. If their bombs hit a building it breaks and the hostages stream out. If the player lands near hostages they will get on the helicopter, and the player can return them to the starting point to safety. Care must be taken not to bomb or land on hostages. The helicopter can hold nine hostages at a time. As the player travels further from their base, they begin to encounter more dangerous enemy craft, including enemy helicopters and spacecraft.
title: Airlift

description:
Winged Warlords is a 1–2 player Joust clone for the BBC Micro. Players take control of a knight with a lance who rides their flying ostrich to do battle against evil computer-controlled ostrich-riding knights. Players can move their character left and right. The ostrich walks if on a platform, but will take to the air when it flaps its wings.

The goal is to hit enemies from a higher vantage point to destroy the knight and its mount. Once the enemy has been hit, an egg falls to one of the platforms below. The player must destroy the eggs before they hatch into a new knight.

Other dangers include lava trolls who attempt to pull knights into the fire, and a vicious pterodactyl. As game play progresses more knights appear and platforms begin to disappear making for more open levels.
title: Winged Warlords

description:
3D Space Ranger is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls their spaceship from a perspective behind the vehicle. The ship moves in all directions, fires forward, and has a limited number of smart bombs that can destroy all enemies on the screen.

The player's goal is to descend into a trench on the enemy starbase and release a missile to destroy the base. To do this, the player must destroy incoming enemy vessels, and avoid colliding with asteroid fields. If the vessel is hit three times it's game over.
title: 3D Space Ranger

description:
Gnasher is a 1-player Pac-Man clone. The player must gobble all the dots in a maze while avoiding the pursuing ghosts. Fruit appears for bonus points.

Special power pellets appear in the four corners of the maze, and if the player eats one of these the ghosts temporarily become vulnerable, and can be eaten by the player. Destroyed ghosts temporarily return to their starting area. The player starts with three lives, and advances to a faster-moving level when all dots are consumed.
title: Gnasher

description:
Froggy is a 1-player Frogger clone. The player must navigate their frog across a busy road and a dangerous river to reach the five holes in the riverbank at the top of the screen. The player moves in the cardinal directions as cars, logs, turtles, and alligators move horizontally across the screen.

Turtles will intermittently submerge, posing a danger to the frog. The frog must hop on an alligator's back, avoiding his teeth or tails. Flies sometimes appear in holes, which can be eaten for bonus points. Dangerous alligators sometimes appear in these holes.

The player starts with three lives and, after safely placing five frogs in holes, the player encounters a faster-moving level with more road traffic and fewer safe spaces to cross the river.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Lot More Traffic and Alligators

title: Froggy

description:
Colditz Adventure is a text adventure for the BBC Micro. The player is a prisoner of war at Colditz Castle during World War II who must successfully escape the Nazis to reach freedom.

The player must explore the castle while avoiding Nazi guards and gathering items for their daring escape. Finally, they must overpower the station's guards and use a cable car to reach their freedom.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature.
title: Colditz Adventure

description:
Lost City is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Many years ago, the famous explorer Ikan Findem began a search for the legendary Diamond of Zandor. Despite many years of searching, he was unsuccessful. He was ultimately found breathing his last in a dry, rock strewn valley.

The player must start off when Ikan Findem left off, parachuting into the valley in search of the Lost City. The player must navigate trackless deserts, explore dark caverns, and climb hazardous mountains in their search for the legendary diamond.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature available. All commands are via VERB NOUN

sample_screenshots.caption: I Arrived in the Jungle Without Boots?

title: Lost City

description:
Gideon's Gamble is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Many years ago, the legendary pirate Hezekiah Gideon buried a great deal of treasure on a far-off desert island. As renowned adventurer Captain Hogwash, the player is commissioned by King Nimblie III to seek out this island and find the treasure.

The player starts on the docks in England, and must explore the local shops and businesses to gather all of the items needed for their voyage. These can be stored at the local warehouse. After preparing for the journey, the player must use these items to deal with dangers at sea. After finally reaching the desert island, the player must overcome more dangers, find the treasure, and safely dig it up.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Gideon's Gamble

description:
Cribbage is a 1-player versus computer card game. Each hand, both players are dealt five cards, one of which is given away to the crib. A fifth card is then randomly chosen from the pile. Players take turns playing their four remaining cards, and can score points with doubles, runs, and card combinations that add to 15 or 31.

The players' initial four cards plus additional flipped card are also then checked for doubles, scores equal to 15 or 31, and runs. One player receives the crib points each round. Cards are visibly displayed on the screen.
title: Cribbage

description:
Mutant Spiders is a 1-player arcade game where the player has been tasked by Planet Earth to defeat the hordes of dangerous three-legged spiders that are attacking the Off-World Colonies.

The player controls a space ship that moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. The enemies fire in three separate directions as they move about. The player has limited time to defeat each alien wave. If the player is hit three times, it's game over.
title: Mutant Spiders

description: Star Battle is a 2-player arcade game for the BBC Micro. Each player controls a small spaceship that can rotate, accelerate, and fire. Alien UFOs and large snakes can be added to the battle screen. Each player starts with 20 health, but loses a point when shot or if they run into an obstacle. Energy cannisters appear on the screen, and picking these up adds three points of energy.
title: Star Battle

description:
Spitfire Command is a 1-player arcade flight game for the BBC Micro played from the perspective of the cockpit. The player takes control of a World War II-era Spitfire fighter plane, and attempts to protect Britain from the incoming Nazi air force.

The player starts with 100 damage points that constantly increase. If enemy craft are lined up in the plane's sights, they can be shot down. The player loses damage points as enemy craft approach. Soldiers parachute from planes, and these can be shot for extra points. If damage reaches 0, the player is shot down. There are six levels of game play.
title: Spitfire Command

description:
Fairground is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro. The player controls a character at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically.

Items move across the screen in three rows in opposite directions and, when an object runs off the bottom level, they appear again at the top. A smiley face moves across the top of the screen. The player must shoot six of these, but if the smiley face crosses the screen one more appears. Smiley faces will sometimes move towards the bottom of the screen, and steal three bullets. Intermittently numbers move across the screen, and these can be shot for additional bullets.

The letters FA, IR, GR, OU, ND start at the beginning of each level, and if these are shot in order the player scores a large bonus. The player has a limited number of bullets, and it's game over when these run out. If the player shoots all items on the screen they move to the next level.

The player then starts a bonus round where they have to shoot a man moving on the screen. Every time the man is shot he reverses direction. This continues until the man escapes off the edge of the screen.
title: Fairground

description:
Rocky is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro. The player must defeat mutants and robots by dropping rocks on them. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and can pick up and drop rocks. Dropped rocks will fall to the bottom of the screen, and if they hit a monster, the monster is destroyed.

Mutants and robots move about the screen and emit a yellow light. Being caught in this beam reduces the player's strength. If the player is touched by a monster or loses all their strength they lose a life. If the player is caught in the beam while not carrying a rock, the enemy transforms into a specter or cruncher. The specter chases the player while the cruncher eats rocks. The player starts with three lives.
title: Rocky

description: Q*bert is an unofficial port of the original Q*Bert for the BBC Micro. The player attempts to color all squares on a pyramid by moving to the different positions. Green balls constantly fall from the top of the pyramid and then bounce off the bottom. Two discs at the edge of the screen transport Q*Bert to the top of the pyramid. The player starts with three lives, and loses a life if they jump off the pyramid or are hit by a falling ball. There are six levels of difficulty to choose from.
title: Q*bert

description: Battle Tank is a 3D tank battle game for the BBC Micro. Played from a 1st-person perspective, the player can rotate their tank left or right, and can move forwards and backwards. Enemy tanks appear, and the player must shoot them before getting hit by return fire. Various pyramids dotting the battlefield provide protection. If the player is hit, their tank is destroyed. Three hits, and it's game over.
title: Battle Tank

description: Road Runner is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro where the player must avoid pursuing vehicles on a laterally scrolling field. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and tries to pick up 10 flags. A map shows the location of flags and enemy vehicles. Limited fuel is available to complete each level. If the player hits a barrier or another car, their vehicle explodes. After collecting all of the flags, the player moves to a more difficult level.
title: Road Runner

description:
Galaxy Birds is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player tries to shoot all the space birds by controlling a ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. One to several birds at a time break off from formation and swoop towards the player. Both the swooping birds and the birds in formation return fire towards the player. If the player is hit they lose a life. Three lives, and it's game over. If an attack wave is defeated, more birds appear on the next level. There are six levels of difficulty that control bird fire rate.
title: Galaxy Birds

description:
Pontoon is a 1–6 player-versus-the-computer card game for the BBC Micro. The player and the computer take turns drawing cards to try to reach 21 without going over. Each turn, the player can stick to hold their current hand or twist for another card.

The players and house start with 50 monetary units, and after the first card has been drawn, the player can choose to bet 1–10 units on the first two cards. A pair on the first two cards allows the hand to be split and played as two hands. Sticking under 16 is not allowed. If four cards total less than 12, then the 5th card can only be twisted. Game play occurs until the player or house has run out of money.
title: Pontoon

description:
Invaders is a Space Invaders clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. Three large bases provide protection from enemy fire, but also block the player's shots. These get damaged when shot.

Enemies move as a group laterally across the screen until they reach the edge, move down one row, and reverse direction. Enemies return fire at the player, and the player must destroy all enemies before they reach the bottom of the screen.

UFOs move across the screen and drop large bombs that slice through bases. The player starts with three lives, and it's game over when all are lost. Each level the enemies move slightly faster.
title: Invaders

description: Olympic Decathlon is an arcade sports game covering the 10 sports of the Olympic decathlon. Players compete by rapidly cycling between two buttons to represent their left and right foot, and an action button which performs actions such as jump, release a discus or javelin, or lower their pole in pole vault. Some of the sports also allow the player to choose the angle to jump. Players can choose individual sports, or compete in a 10-sports Olympic event. In this, the player must reach a minimal score in each event in order to qualify for the next one.
title: Olympic Decathlon

description:
Fistful of Fun is a compilation of five games for the BBC Micro, two of which are newly published in this collection:

  • 3-D Space Raider: A 3D space-flight game where the player travels between sectors destroying alien vessels and protecting their bases.
  • Bug Blaster: A Centipede clone.
  • Growing Pains: An arcade game where the player must avoid snails and bees while trying to water plants in a garden.
  • Tarzan: A side-scrolling arcade game.
  • Uncle Claude: A top-down arcade game.
title: Fistful of Fun

description:
Ultron is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is besieged on the planet Ultron by bands of roving aliens. The player is armed with their spaceship and trusty photon gun, and can move laterally and shoot vertically to blast incoming vessels. When the player clears every ship on the screen they advance to a new challenge. Aliens have a variety of movement patterns and firing rates. Every five levels the player encounters an asteroid field that must be avoided. The player has limited energy that is drained by firing and, if this reaches 0, the ship is destroyed. Every fifth level the player further encounters their mothership, which if they safely dock with will recharge their energy. The player starts with a total of three lives.
title: Ultron

description:
Ebony Tower / Xanadu Cottage is a compilation of two text adventure games for the BBC Micro. Both games have a save/restore feature available, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry.

In Ebony Tower, the player has been tasked with defeating a dragon located in an ebony-colored tower somewhere on a deserted island. The player must explore trackless mountains, underground caves, crypts, and other dangerous places in order to defeat the dragon.

In Xanadu Cottage, the player starts in a small cottage in the woods, but soon branches out to explore the local city to find treasures for the museum curator. These must be brought back to the starting cottage. The player explores the local woods, a busy highway, factory, and the local recreation center including ice rink, pool, and musical theater.

sample_screenshots.caption: Xanadu Cottage: I Plunge to my Death

title: Ebony Tower / Xanadu Cottage

description:
Sim is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The energy crisis is reaching a catastrophic level. The galactic superhero, Hercules K. Orangebottom, has been commissioned by H. M. Govt. to go in search of Simarils to feed the reactor.

The player controls a character in a jetpack who moves laterally, and can accelerate upwards. Gravity will constantly pull the character down. Contact with any enemy leads to loss of life. Hercules can pick up or drop one item at a time. The player must search the 70 fixed screens of underground corridors, and avoid a wide variety of enemies and dangers to collect all 10 Simarils and feed them into the reactor in the temple. The player starts with three lives.
title: Sim

description:
Starship Discovery is a 1st-person space flight simulator for the BBC Micro.

The interplanetary spacecraft Discovery is to embark on a voyage to distant Saturn, a journey of some three years duration. During that time it is possible that minor repair work may need to be carried out on certain parts of the ship.

Discovery is equipped with single-astronaut EVA (Extra Vehicular Activity) pods to carry out deep space repairs. This simulator tests the ability to pilot an EVA pod through eight progressive levels of difficulty before the Flight Training Crew will give clearance for the Saturn mission.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the EVA pod has 6 degrees of freedom control consisting 6 separate jets consisting of pitch, yaw, roll, forward, lateral, and vertical movement. These have 9 levels of power, and must be shut off when not wanting to be used. The player also controls 2 manipulator arms that can be moved up, down, opened, and closed. The instrument screen provides information on EVA pod forward, lateral, and vertical speeds, as well as rate of change. The instrument panel also displays remaining fuel and horizontal and vertical angles to and from Discovery to allow for safe return to the ship. All successful missions must end with a safe ship docking.

There are 8 levels of mission difficulty, and the player receives a score based upon their performance. This score must be sufficiently high to receive a promotion to the next level.
title: Starship Discovery

description:
Roboman is a 1-player arcade clone of Robotron: 2084 for the BBC Micro.

An error of genetic engineering has blessed the player with the superhuman powers needed to combat the electronic nasties. The player controls a human character who can move and fire in eight directions. He tries to kill all the vulnerable enemies and save the humans before they're killed by robots.

There are several kinds of enemies. Grunts walk towards the player and are easily killed. Hulks are large and indestructible but are pushed back when shot. Cannon balls bounce randomly about the stage, and mutating brains transform grunts so that they move much faster. The player starts with three lives, and gains an additional life every 20,000 points.
title: Roboman

description:
Chartbuster is a compilation of five previously-released games for the BBC Micro:

  • Blagger
  • Eagle Empire
  • Monaco
  • Neanderthal Man
  • Web Runner
title: Chartbuster

description:
Neanderthal Man is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

As one of the earliest human beings on Earth, surrounded by hostile prehistoric animals, the player must ensure the survival of themselves and their family. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and can throw their spear to kill the predators that threaten their children.

Three children hide inside the cave at the bottom of the screen, but when they get hungry they will head out in search of the food on the screen. The player can keep them in the cave by knocking food down into the cave. If the children or the player are attacked by an animal, then they lose a life.
title: Neanderthal Man

description:
Monaco is a 1-player top-down racing game.

The player moves laterally on a vertically scrolling racetrack to avoid other racers and fast moving ambulances, accelerating to try to overcome these vehicles. Water hazards on the track cause the player to swerve left and right. If the player contacts another vehicle, their car is stopped and placed on the left side of the track. Intermittently the track narrows increasing the challenge.

The further the racer travels the more points they receive. At the beginning of the race, the goal is 2,000 points within 1 minute to qualify for the main race. After this, the player has three cars to try to reach 9,999 points.
title: Monaco

description:
Web Runner is a 1-player arcade game where the player navigates a spider web dodging dangerous spider attacks. The player follows the lines of the web and, at each intersection, can choose to turn clockwise or counterclockwise. Spiders continuously appear, and these must be avoided or shot, and the player's shots can bounce around corners before dissipating.

The goal is to move into all seven edges of the web holding it in place, and leaving a bomb in these locations. The player can then escape off the right edge of the screen as the web is destroyed. As levels progress, faster-moving bugs and flying wasps begins to appear, further endangering the player.
title: Web Runner

description:
Spitfire Flight Simulator is a 1st-person Mark XIV Spitfire simulator for the BBC Micro.

The player attempts takeoff and flight of the aircraft. The player has control of aircraft pitch, throttle, friction adjustor, flaps, rudder, undercarriage, and supercharger. The instrument panel includes an artificial horizon, airspeed indicator, rate of climb meter, altimeter, turn and slip meter, direction indicator, RPMs, boost gauge, fuel gauge, flap lever, undercarriage indicator, elevator trim meter, and ignition switch.
title: Spitfire Flight Simulator

description:
Cosmic Asteroids is a 1-player Asteroids variant for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small spaceship that can rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, fire directly forwards, and accelerate in the direction it's facing. It can also hyper warp to move around the screen at random. Asteroids float about the screen and, when shot, these break into four smaller pieces that must be destroyed. Alien UFOs appear on the screen and fire towards the player. When all asteroid fragments are destroyed the player moves to the next level.
title: Cosmic Asteroids

description:
Dambusters is a side-scrolling arcade game based upon World War II's Operation Chastise (also known as the "Dambusters Raid").

The player controls a British aircraft with the goal of destroying German hydroelectric dams by bouncing bombs into them over the water. The plane moves in all directions, and has a nose and tail gun used to shoot down defending German planes. As the player approaches the water, spotlights appear that allow the player to judge the correct distance and height to release their bomb, which will hopefully bounce into the dam and destroy it. The player has three planes in total, and each successful dam destroyed leads to a higher challenge, adding more defending planes and anti-aircraft guns.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lining up Altitude over the Water

title: Dambusters

description:
ABM is a 1-player Missile Command variant for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a central defense turret designed to protect the six surrounding cities located at the bottom of the screen. Rounds of incoming missiles, each more difficult than the last, come from above. Sometimes the missiles will split into many smaller pieces as they descend.

The player controls a target to try to shoot down the incoming dangers. The player has unlimited shots, but if their turret or all six cities are destroyed, it's game over.
title: ABM

description:
Video Fruit Machine is a casino slot machine gambling game for the BBC Micro. It costs 10 pence per spin, and the player can choose their starting funds.

After each spin the player is assigned a random number of nudges that allows them to move wheels up or down over a limited time. If the player has a winning spin, they can choose to collect their money or gamble for a 50 percent chance of doubling their win versus losing it all. This continues until the maximum win of £2.
title: Video Fruit Machine

description:
Tutankhamun's Revenge is a 1-player arcade platformer for the BBC Micro.

In 1922, centuries after Tutankhamun's tomb was sealed and forgotten by the ancient Egyptians, its steps were uncovered for the first time. Within the tomb, the excavators found the message, "Death will come to those who disturb the sleep of the Pharaohs". Almost immediately, some people associated with the excavation died unexpectedly. The player must explore the many rooms of the Tomb of Tutankhamun and uncover all its treasures.

The player moves laterally and can jump. If the player falls too far or are touched by an enemy, they lose a life. Numerous vertical- and laterally-moving platforms add extra difficulty. The player attempts to gather keys which open doors to other chambers. The player starts with five lives.
title: Tutankhamun's Revenge

description:
Megarok is a 1-player Asteroids clone for the BBC Micro.

Megaroks bounce about the screen and, when the player shoots them, they break into two smaller pieces, which then break into two smaller pieces, and are ultimately destroyed.

The player controls a small ship that can rotate left or right, fire straight ahead, and accelerate or apply reverse thrust. The ship is also equipped with a short-acting shield. The player starts with 100 energy, and each rock collision decreases their power, ultimately leading to game over with energy hits 0.
title: Megarok

description:
Old Father Time is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Old Father Time has tasked the player with recovering his hourglass and Staff of Power, and to return them before the Sands of Time run out. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and during the player's exploration they must search a trackless forest and a dark and dangerous cavern system. Dangers include a variety of traps, a cunning genie, and the deadly Medusa. There is a save/restore feature available.
title: Old Father Time

description:
Oblivion is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. The ship can also move forwards on the screen. Red alien ships move towards the player. Initially they move straight, but as the player defeats more enemies they begin to swerve towards the player and their bullets follow the player. Yellow enemies also appear that rapidly move side to side, whose bullets chase the player. The player starts with three lives, and gains a new life at 1,500 points.
title: Oblivion

description:
Sea Lord is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player was happily sailing around in their minisub, when suddenly the voice of some power-crazed dictator called the Sea Lord boomed over the radio. He's under the impression he owns the local waters, and trespassers will be swiftly eliminated.

The player controls a ship that rotates left and right and fires directly forwards. Enemy vehicles appear, and move about the screen. Icebergs on the screen block the view of the player and the enemies. The player needs to shoot all items on the screen, and proceeds to the next level with new enemies to shoot. The player starts with theee lives, and gains a new life every 1,500 points.
title: Sea Lord

description:
Blitz is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player flies a plane horizontally across the screen and, when it reaches the edge, it moves down slightly, and crosses again. The player drops bombs that destroy sections of the buildings below. The goal is to destroy the city before colliding into an object. Artillery fire at the player and need to be destroyed. The player moves to progressively more difficult cities as they are destroyed.
title: Blitz

description:
Alien is a 1-player invisible maze game for the BBC Micro.

The player has been trapped in the ship's ventilator system without a weapon, pursued by a dangerous alien. Played on a 21 x 21 grid, the player can move in the cardinal directions, while being chased by an alien. There are numerous walls that the player can't see in the dark until they bump into them. The player knows the location of the alien and themselves. There are only two exits: one forward and one port. The player tries to exit safely before being eaten by the alien.
title: Alien

description:
Thargoids is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player has become stranded in a Thargoid pen on planet Beetlejuice IV. The Thargoids are hungry and have decided the player would make a good lunch. The Thargoids will always move towards the player, and the player must try to lead them into pools of explosive Gloop which cover the area. If the player touches Gloop or a Thargoid, it's game over.
title: Thargoids

description:
Airlift is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a helicopter that moves in the cardinal directions, collecting alien treasure amid a meteor shower. The player starts at the base in the bottom left, and must gather alien urns by flying above them, and returning them to the helipad.

Radiation storms intermittently approach, and meteors rain from above. The player starts with 30 lives, and loses one life for each collision with a wall and one point for every move during a radiation storm. Getting hit by a meteor costs 10 points. Every 3,000 points, the player moves to a new level.
title: Airlift

description:
Dragon Quest is a 1-player role-playing game for the BBC Micro.

The player enters a dark dungeon with the goal of killing a dragon and reaching level 2 by gaining 1,000 experience points.

At the beginning of the game the player rolls statistics from: strength, intelligence, wisdom, constitution, dexterity, and charisma. The player can also choose a class, either warrior or magician. At the beginning of each adventure, the player starts with gold, and the ability to purchase up to seven items from food, weapons, armor, light, and spells.

Upon starting the adventure, the player moves about in the dark unless they have a light source. Rooms can be individually illuminated. The player moves north, south, east or west; rooms are graphically displayed on the screen. In combat, the monster is displayed on the screen, and the player each turn can attack or flee the creature. The player receives experience for successful combat, and can gain treasures.

The player can further drink potions, eat food to heal, and listen to doors before entering rooms to look for monsters.
title: Dragon Quest

description:
Micro Derby is a 1–6 player horse race gambling game for the BBC Micro.

Each player starts with £100, and can bid on one of five horses with displayed odds. An animated race shows the winner, and the player receives a payout if they chose the correct horse.
title: Micro Derby

description:
Golf is a 1–2 player sports game for the BBC Micro.

Players compete over 18 holes of golf. Players choose a handicap from 1–30, and a difficulty, including: hooking, slicing, poor distance, bunkers, putting, or conceit. Each hole is shown from a top-down perspective, and the player is supplied the distance to the hole. The player chooses from four woods and nine irons. When choosing a wood the player opts to hook or slice, while with an iron power from 7–99 percent is chosen. The game automatically aims towards the hole with some variation. Once on the green the game switches to a sideview where the player must input putting power from 1–15, with the correct strength needed to sink the ball. Score is carried over 18 holes.
title: Golf

description:
Dogfight is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Each player controls a plane that can turn left or right, speed up, and fire straight forwards. The players attempt to shoot each other and, if hit, the plane bursts into flames and falls to the ground. If a player hits the ground, another plane, or the flaming wreckage of a destroyed plane, they are destroyed. There is an option to add three barrage balloons. The first player to lose 30 planes is defeated.
title: Dogfight

description:
Spacewarp is a 1-player space strategy game for the BBC Micro.

As an officer in the Federation Deep Space Fleet, the player must show their suitability for the position of Intergalactic Upholder of the Peace, Class 1a. The player is provided with a complete starship simulator with a number of increasingly difficult missions to show their skill.

Scenarios include:

  • The Organian Rim Intrusion
  • The Romulan Incident
  • The Great Galactic War
  • A Piracy Outbreak
  • Into the Unknown
  • Routine Patrol

Operating the starship requires three separate control systems. The helm console allows navigation of warp speeds and intelligence functions. The battle display allows navigation at impulse (sublight) speeds and all combat operations. Thirdly, the ship's computer allows precise allocation and distribution of energy.

The ship's dilithium crystals produce energy at a set rate. Ship systems include warp engines, impulse engines, scanners, life support, and damage control. Weapons includes phasers and photo torpedoes.
title: Spacewarp

description:
Polaris is a 1-player vertically scrolling arcade game for the BBC Micro.

As the commander of the Polaris submarine, the player's mission is to sink enemy shipping. A convoy of cargo and warships are approaching from the top of the screen. The player can move in the cardinal directions, fire forward and aft, and surface or submerge.

Enemy barrages appear near the player, and if the player is hit 6 times their ship sinks. The submarine is harder to hit while submerged, but must periodically come to the surface for air. As the ship is damaged it may develop malfunctioning torpedo tubes, engines, or air valves.
title: Polaris

description:
Space Pirates is a 1-player arcade game for multiple systems.

The player controls a space ship under siege by robotic pirates. The ship can rotate, thrust and fire forwards. Some of the pirates will try to get close to the player and explode, destroying the ship. Others will attempt to steal the player's life-pods, which represent an additional ship if the current one is destroyed. If a ship is pulled off the screen it is lost to the player. It's game over when all ships are lost.
title: Space Pirates

description:
Space Invaders is a 1–2 player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. The enemy ships move as a group to the edge of the screen, move down one row, and reverse direction. Enemy ships continually return fire towards the player. As enemy ships are destroyed the remaining vessels move faster.

There are two levels of difficulty, amateur and professional. Four large barriers offer protection for the player. The player starts with three lives, and gains a new life every 1,500 points.
title: Space Invaders

description:
Galaxy Wars is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a space ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. There are four levels of difficulty which affect enemy ship movement and fire rate. Ships either move laterally across the screen, fall towards the bottom of the screen leaving fire to avoid, or swoop towards the player.

When all enemy ships are destroyed, the player moves to the next level. Every third level involves a docking sequence where the player must align themselves with their mothership. The player starts with three lives.
title: Galaxy Wars

description:
Brainstorm is a 2-player puzzle game for the BBC Micro.

Each player controls a laser on opposite sides of a 20 x 15 field, and has a single brain that they must protect from enemy laser attack and friendly fire. Each turn the player can move their laser to a different row, or place a mirror with a deflection factor of 1–8. When a laser hits a deflection point it changes direction, and the laser can hit up to 25 mirrors before running out of power.

When all positions have been filled with mirrors, it's game over. Mirrors can not be set up in front of a laser or beside a brain. There are three difficulties of board layout.
title: Brainstorm

description:
Sea Adventure is a text adventure with graphics for the BBC Micro.

The player was sailing in the South Seas when their catamaran was destroyed by killer whales. The player managed to launch a lifeboat, and is now adrift at sea. Their task is to return home to England.

All commands are via 10 function keys to move, pick up, drop, and use items. The player can visit a number of islands, evade pirates, outsmart whales, and find a number of treasures in their adventure. All locations are graphically displayed.
title: Sea Adventure

description:
Chieftain is a 1-player tank arcade game for the the BBC Micro.

The player controls a tank that moves in the cardinal directions, trying to destroy the enemy blue tanks. The player contends with lakes and mountains they cannot cross, as well as trees and chalets that can be destroyed by shooting them. If the player is destroyed, it's game over. The player gains points for all items destroyed.
title: Chieftain

description:
Trench is a 1-player arcade game based upon the Star Wars trench run.

The player's home planet is doomed unless they can destroy the Empire's Death Star by sending a missile down an exhaust vent at the end of a trench on the Star's surface. The player controls an X-Wing fighter and attempt to avoid incoming enemy ships and defensive lasers. They must not hit the sides or bottom, nor leave the trench. When they get close to the vent they must position their missile sight over the vent and fire their missile. There are nine levels of difficulty which increase the length of time to reach the exhaust port.
title: Trench

description:
High-Rise Horror is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Count Dracula has rented a luxury block of flats and invited a few friends to stay. The local people are terrified and hire the famous ghost-hunter Vladimir to help them. Vladimir can move along platforms and move up and down levels. To defend himself, Vladimir can release stationary balloons that destroy monsters if they run into them. Some monsters move about randomly, and some chase after the player. The goal is to reach the highest floor of each level, and if the player takes too long Dracula appears and destroys the player. The player starts with three lives.
title: High-Rise Horror

description:
Checkout is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player tries to color all squares on a 7 x 7 grid by walking over them. The player must avoid the enemy robot that moves about. Squares go from dark, to striped, to colored, and then back to dark when walked on. If the level is completed in under 30 seconds a bonus is awarded. The player starts with three lives, and loses a life if caught by the robot. A countdown to the left of the screen represents the time until the robot fires its lasers in the cardinal directions.
title: Checkout

description:
'Owzat is a cricket game between the Australian and English teams.

The player selects the overs per inns, max overs/bowlers, first team at bat, innings, and automatic bowling or batting. Fielders can be individually placed. The bowling player can choose a short, on length, or up bowl. The batting player must swing their bat to try to connect with the bowl.
title: 'Owzat

description:
Gomoku / Reversi is a combination of two board games for the BBC Micro.

Gomoku: Played on a 19 x 19 board, players take turns placing a piece on the board. The first player to make five in a row is the winner. There are two levels of computer difficulty.

Reversi: Played on an 8 x 8 board, players takes turns placing pieces on a board. The player claims all opponent pieces located between two pieces of the same color. There are six levels of opponent difficulty.
title: Gomoku / Reversi

description:
Landfall is a 1-player game for the BBC Micro.

As captain of the space ship Falcon, the player is in control of the return of an exploratory flight deep into outer space. The ship has made many fantastic discoveries, from intelligent gas-based lifeforms to a strange race of radioactive dwarves. As the ship approaches the outer limits of the solar system, the crew realizes they're running out of fuel to make it back to Earth. The ship must make an emergency landing on Mars.

Played from the cockpit viewpoint, the player must carefully navigate the ship. The player has 10 levels of engine burn, from off to maximum deceleration. As the ship speeds up it heats up, and if the shields hit greater than 5000 °C, the ship will burn up. The ship must land at a velocity of less than 10 m/s to land safely. The player has limited fuel to manage the descent. The player must also manage X and Y velocity to safely land, keeping the ship aligned with the landing zone.
title: Landfall

description:
Cruncher is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player walks about a 14 x 13 grid trying to disarm the flashing time bombs before time runs out. The character can move in the cardinal directions, and can also slide the entire row of tiles they are standing on left or right. Tiles the player has walked on cannot be moved across again that level. Dangers include skull-shaped mines and boots that walk about the level. The player starts with three lives, and loses a life if a mine explodes or they touch an enemy. Each stage has an additional pair of boots to avoid.
title: Cruncher

description:
Bug Bomb is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

In the year 2184, men were sent down into the earth to wander the electronic grids that provide the power supplies for the cities. Henry was one such man, tasked with defeating the grid bugs that lived there and fed on the currents.

The game is played on a field of five horizontal and seven vertical intersecting passageways; Henry can move through these, shooting in the opposite direction from his movement. This leaves a bouncing projectile that continues to move about the field. The goal is to shoot the grid bugs who fire and move randomly about. Henry loses a life if he touches a bug or a projectile. Each level has more or faster moving bugs.
title: Bug Bomb

description:
Noc-a-Bloc is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is in a room filled with blocks and a bunch of fierce spods whom the player must kill without being touched in order to advance to the next stage. Spods destroy blocks as they walk about. Blocks can be destroyed if pressed when against a wall or another block, but can also be pushed a distance, squashing spods. Spods can also be killed by pushing against an edge which will turn yellow for a few seconds. If the spod walks in that spot it becomes stunned, and the player can walk over the spod to kill it.

There are three star blocks on the level that can't be destroyed. These can destroy spods, but can also be knocked in a line for bonus points. On early stages there are four Spods to kill, but on higher stages this number increases. Only four spods can appear on a screen at a time. The player starts with three lives, and an extra life is awarded at 50,000 points.
title: Noc-a-Bloc

description:
Thunderball is a 2-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Game play is divided into three components. The purpose of the first two sections is to obtain ammunition pods which carry through to section three.

In the first section, players try to demolish two sections of wall by bouncing a ball into it. Each player controls a paddle that moves laterally. The paddles are located at the top and bottom of the screen while the wall is located in the center. Once the walls are demolished, the ball bounces vertically until in contacts one of the three acorns that move laterally at the center of the wall.

In the second section, the bat becomes a horizontally-moving laser base which fires towards the center of the screen. The outer wall now moves in the opposite direction of the central conveyor. The goal is to clear a path to the central ammo conveyor where ammo pods can be claimed by the player. Then all pods are claimed from the conveyor belt both players enter section three.

In section three each player starts off with a bouncing ball in the center of their own cyclotron. The goal is to entirely fill the player's fuel tanks, or completely deplete their opponent's tank. In the cyclotron the player can transfer fuel and ammo from the secondary to the primary tanks. Fuel can be gained by firing at the target located on the piston. Ammo is credited to the secondary tank by colliding with the player's own ammo pods. Ammo can be used to blast the other player and deplete their fuel stocks.
title: Thunderball

description:
Flip! The Cartoon Strategy Game is a 2-player tile-matching game for the BBC Micro.

Players take turns uncovering two animated tiles on a 10 x 4 board. When a player matches two tiles, they receive two points and the content under those tiles is revealed. There are two wild cards in each puzzle. The goal is to guess the word that is revealed under the tiles for 10 points, but an incorrect guess grants the opponent 1 point.
title: Flip! The Cartoon Strategy Game

description:
International Megasports / The Genesis Project is a package containing a 1–4 player Olympiad sports game and a 1-player 3D space shooter for the BBC Micro.

In International Megasports, the player competes in seven sporting events: High jump, long jump, 100m spring, 110m hurdles, archery, and skeet shooting. During each event the player is given three attempts to meet the qualifying score for the competition. The player can set records by hitting one of the three world record scores. All running events are controlled by rapidly tapping between two keys. The third key is used for actions like jumping or shooting. In skeet shooting, the player can fire from the left or right barrel from their shotgun as a target moves rapidly up and down. In archery, the player must deal with wind effects and set the angle of their shot to try to hit targets that move across the screen. In the high jump, the player must time their leap to not hit the post.

In The Genesis Project, the year is 2143 AD. The Star Federation has managed to maintain an extremely fragile cease fire between the planets within the six zones of the Gamme-Serti System. Now, planet Targon-3 has claimed a rare mineral Trilithium found on an asteroid.and, to reinforce its claim, has constructed six Cobolithium Detonation Devices in each of the zones within the system. The player has been given command of the advanced star cruiser, the Genesis Probe. The mission is to travel through all the zones and neutralize the devices.

Played from a 1st-person perspective, the player uses their twin Q-Class phasers to destroy incoming enemy vessels. Asteroids can be destroyed to harvest dilithium, which can be reprocessed into an explosive to destroy the enemy bombs. The player can access the intergalactic map and ship status, and hyperspace to different combat zones.
title: International Megasports / The Genesis Project

description:
The Complete BBC is a compilation of previously-released games for the BBC Micro.

  • Bug Eyes II
  • Chrysalis
  • Drain Mania
  • Flip! The Cartoon Strategy Game
  • International Megasports
  • Space Agent Zelda
  • The Genesis Project
title: The Complete BBC

description:
BBC Bonanza is a collection of 5 game otherwise released independently for BBC Micro:

  • Contraption
  • Psycastria
  • The Last of the Free
  • Thunderstruck
  • Ultron

And two games only released for this compilation:

  • Space Ranger: Arcade game where the player must land their space probe on the five landing pads at the bottom of the screen while avoiding asteroids that fly horizontally across the screen.
  • Wizzy's Mansion: Wizzy, the incompetent wizard, has a problem. A nasty monster has taken over the room at the top of his 50-room mansion. The player must collect all the spell book pages to rid himself of the monster. The player moves left, right and jumps between platforms, and can climb or descend ladders. If the player falls too far or touches an enemy they lose a life.

sample_screenshots.caption: Space Ranger: On the Landing Pad

title: BBC Bonanza

description:
Beeb-Beep is a 1-player memory game for the BBC Micro.

Players attempt to memorize and repeat a series of notes ranging from 5–22 notes long, increasing by one note each round. Game play can be with four or six different notes.
title: Beeb-Beep

description:
Candy Floss / Star Trek is a combination business management game and Star Trek variant

In Candy Floss, the player tries to sell cotton candy in Blackpool, England. Each turn the player is given a weather report and the cost of cotton candy production. The player must decide how much candy to try to sell, the cost per unit, and the advertising budget. The player tries to maximize profit each turn.

Star Trek is a strategy game where the player must destroy a specific number of Klingon vessels within a set number of days. The universe is divided into 8 x 8 quadrants, each of which are divided into 8 x 8 sectors. Long-range sensors view the characteristics of nearby quadrants, while short range sectors show all items in the current quadrant. Stars provided navigation hazards, and star bases allow replenishing of energy and the ship's limited torpedoes. The ship has limited energy which can be used to supply shields or phasers when under attack by Klingon vessels.
title: Candy Floss / Star Trek

description:
3-D Maze is a 1st-person maze game.

The computer creates a maze ranging from 3x3 to 29x29 in size. The player starts in the northwest corner and the exit is in the far southeast. Played from a 1st-person perspective, the computer times how long it takes to escape. Each time the player views the map it costs 30 seconds.
title: 3-D Maze

description:
Hyperdrive is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Evil aliens attacked a space explorer who landed on their planet. They put him in a grid-like maze, and set an increasing number of drone aliens after him.

The player controls the explorer on the grid, and they move in the cardinal directions and fire directly forwards. Enemy drones move randomly about the maze, and each level starts with an additional drone. Occasionally Evil Otto enters the level, and moves directly towards the player. There are 10 levels of game difficulty. If the player is caught by aliens three times it's game over.
title: Hyperdrive

description:
Atlantis is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the BBC Micro.

A legend recorded by the Greek philosopher Plato tells of a great island west of the pillars of Hercules, adorned with every beauty. Circa 9400 B.C., an attack was made on Europe by the people of Atlantis. But these invaders were driven off by the Europeans. Later the island's inhabitants became wicked, and Atlantis was, as a consequence, swallowed up by the ocean.

The year is now 2100 A.D. and, once again, Europe is under threat from the Atlantians, aided by high technology weapons and defense systems. The player's mission is to infiltrate the defenses of the undersea city of Atlantis and destroy everything they see.

The player controls a submarine that fires directly forwards and drops bombs. The submarine can move in all directions in the left half of the screen while enemy dangers approach from the right. The game is divided into multiple stages where new dangers appear. These include missiles launching from the ground, caverns full of jellyfish, ships dropping mines, barricades that raise from the floor, attacking eels, and other dangers. The player gains points from destroying the Atlantian infrastructure on the seafloor. The player starts with three lives and, if they hit a danger, they restart an individual stage.
title: Atlantis

description:
Beebmunch is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the BBC Micro.

The player moves the muncher around the maze trying to eat all the dots. The muncher must avoid the three ghosts who move constantly towards the player. Super points score 10 points, and temporarily make the ghosts vulnerable. Fruit scores 50 points, but if a ghost eats the fruit no more fruit will appear on that level. If the player touches a ghost they lose a life, and the player starts with three lives.
title: Beebmunch

description:
Leap-Frog is a 1-player Frogger clone for the BBC Micro.

The player must navigate their frog across a busy road and a dangerous river to reach the five holes in the riverbank at the top of the screen. The player moves in the cardinal directions as cars, trucks, logs, snakes, and turtles move horizontally across the screen.

Turtles will intermittently submerge, posing a danger to the frog. Flies sometimes appear in holes, which can be eaten for bonus points. Dangerous birds sometimes appear in these holes, and prevent the frog from reaching safety. Snakes cross on the river bank between the road and the river on higher levels..

The player starts with three lives and, after safely placing five frogs in holes, the player encounters a faster-moving level with more road traffic and fewer safe spaces to cross the river.
title: Leap-Frog

description:
Casino is a 1-player gambling game featuring roulette and blackjack.

  • Blackjack: The player and computer take turns drawing cards with the goal of being the closest to 21 without going over. Each turn the player can draw a card or stick. The player can split any pair except 4s, 5s, or 10s. If the first two cards total 9, 10, or 11 with an ace the player can buy for their original stake.

  • Roulette: The player can place bets on the numbers 1–36, even, odd, black, red, 1st 12, 2nd 12, 3rd 12, 1–18, or 19–36. The ball is animated as it moves about the roulette wheel.
title: Casino

description:
Family Games is a compilation of several small games and programs for the BBC Micro.

  • Beetle: A dice-rolling game where the player draws a picture of a beetle based upon the number rolled.
  • Dice: Simulates the rolling of 1–2 dice.
  • Grand National: The player bids money on 1 of 6 horses, and then watches them race across the screen.
  • Hangman: A word-guessing game where the player must fill in the blanks before the picture of a hangman is drawn.
  • Music: Program that plays music and displays graphics.
  • Kryptogram: A player enters a word, and the program rearranges the letters for the other player to guess.
title: Family Games

description:
Breakout is a 1-player arcade game, and Breakout clone.

The player moves a paddle horizontally along the bottom of the screen. The goal is to bounce a ball into the blocks at the top of the screen to break them all away. If a bounce is missed the player loses a ball, and starts with five balls. There are six levels of difficulty.
title: Breakout

description:
Mutant Invaders is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small ship that moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically.
