The player can also hyperspace to a random place at the bottom of the screen if surrounded by danger. The player cannot move or fire while a previously fired energy beam remains on the screen.

Alien refueling bases traverse the top of the screen, and can be shot for bonus points. Alien vessels have the ability to temporarily phase into hyperspace where they cannot be shot. Red mutant invaders cannot be destroyed, and will sit at the bottom of the screen endangering the player. They can be removed by luring a green invader into their position.

Every 500 points, all invaders turn to mutant invaders, one of which is real and the others are fake. The real mutant must be destroyed to clear the enemies. This pattern repeats, and at 1,000 points, the invaders return to green with two mutants present. The player starts with three lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fuel Ship Crosses as Green Invader Destroys ME

title: Mutant Invaders

description:
Star Maze is an unofficial port of Star Maze for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small ship which can rotate 360 degrees, always firing from the forward cannons. The player can accelerate depending on the direction they are facing. The goal is to collect nine jewels from the maze to complete a level, while avoiding or destroying enemy ships.

The player has rapidly depleting fuel stores, and must gather resources as they explore. If the player touches a wall in the large maze they are exploring they lose a life. Numerous dangers in habit the mazes, including: asteroids that break into smaller pieces if shot, enemy ships that fire towards the player, space eggs which hatch if shot, and spinning alien vessels that move towards the player if shot. If the player is struck by alien fire, they are destroyed. The player starts with a total of four ships, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Star Maze

description:
Eagle's Wing is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls an airplane flying through a tight canyon with rivers and trees at the bottom. The plane can move up, down, accelerate and decelerate, but burns fuel at a set rate. The plane has a limited number of destructive missiles, but is also armed with surface and air fire to destroy incoming enemy installations. The plane can take limited damage from enemy fire before being destroyed, and will explode if it hits the canyon walls or runs out of fuel.

The goal is to reach and destroy enemy missile silos and command centers; the player can refuel, rearm, and repair if the reach their sister plane.
title: Eagle's Wing

description:
Spooks and Spiders is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a character who moves laterally, jumps a short distance, and climbs up and down ladders. The goal is to collect the key and open all of the doors to find the imprisoned damsel.

The player faces dangers including ghosts and spiders. Spiders can be defeated by jumping on them, but ghosts can only be safely jumped over. Ghosts will later turn into skulls, which are faster moving than ghosts. All the monsters move up and down ladders and along platforms.

The player has 1000 time units to reach the key, after which one door will have an arrow appear under it. The player must reach and unlock this door within 500 time units. When a door is unlocked, the player has 500 time units to reach the next indicated door. The final door will contain the damsel. If the player runs out of time or touches an enemy they lose a life.

When the player loses a life, previously unlocked doors remain open, but the player must collect a new key.
title: Spooks & Spiders

description:
Jet Boat is a 1-player scrolling boat racing game for the BBC Micro.

The player navigates a boat through a large race track, and can turn left, right, and accelerate. The player has 70 seconds to finish each lap and, if they hit the shore or other dangers, they are slowed down. Each lap of the track adds additional dangers to the track, including: ducks, rocks, flags, docked boats, large overturned ships, sea serpents, and barricades. If the player doesn't complete a lap it's game over.
title: Jet Boat

description:
Galaxian is a BBC Micro clone of the arcade game Galaxian.

The player controls a ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. Alien ships move as a group and fire towards the player. Several enemy ships break loose from the group and sweep towards the player. When all enemies are destroyed, the next level has more ships break loose at the same time. The player starts with three lives.
title: Galaxian

description:
Blackjack is a 1-player graphical card game for the BBC Micro.

The player flips cards one at a time trying to get as close to 21 as possible without going over. The player sets their starting funds, and how much they wish to bet per hand. The player starts with one card, and can stick or twist. If the computer and player tie, the player wins.
title: Blackjack

description:
Apollo is a 1-player Lunar Lander variant for the BBC Micro.

The player attempts to safely land their landing craft on the moon. The player can apply lateral force to the left or right, and can apply force to decelerate their craft. The player has limited fuel to safely conduct their landing. The ship starts in orbit around a large planet, and can decelerate their craft to begin the landing process. As the player approaches closer to the surface there are four levels of zoom. The landing craft must safely land on a flat area of the planet at a sufficiently slow velocity. After a successful landing, the player attempts a new landing with more difficult terrain.
title: Apollo

description:
Smash 7 is a compilation of 7 previously-released games by Software Invasion.

  • 3D Bomb Alley
  • Attack on Alpha Centauri
  • Eagle's Wing
  • Gunsmoke
  • Spooks & Spiders
  • Street Machine
  • Vortex
title: Smash 7

description:
Orpheus is a 1-player arcade game telling the story of the famed Greek poet as he descend into Hades in search of his lost wife Eurydice.

The player controls Orpheus in his vessel as he sails across the river Styx to gather five golden harps and return them to the other side. The craft can be rotated left or right, and Orpheus can throw a discus directly forwards. The current of the river pulls the vessel to the left of the screen, and Orpheus can only move upstream by paddling against the current, or slightly to the north or south. The ship will move rapidly to the left of the screen. Orpheus can only gather one harp at a time, and must return it to the shores of the bottom of the screen.

Orpheus contains seven progressively more difficult screens. The player must avoid rocks and other dangers in the stream. They must also avoid sea serpents, logs, skulls, and other aquatic dangers from Greek mythology.
title: Orpheus

description:
Copter Capers is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

While setting off in a helicopter to rescue survivors from a fishing boat that has broken up in heavy seas, the player finds turbulence has transported them to another time. The player is now being attacked by German submarines, zeppelins, and helicopters from another generation.

On each level, the player must fly close to the water to drop a rescue ladder to pick up fisherman lost in the sea. They must be rescued and taken one at a time to the landing platform at the left of the screen. The helicopter can drop bombs or fire straight ahead to defend from incoming enemy vessels. The player has 30 shots per level, and has limited fuel to complete each stage.

Every third level is a bonus stage where the player attempts to land on a moving platform for bonus points. The player receives an additional helicopter every 10,000 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Picking up a Survivor while an Airship Flies Past

title: Copter Capers

description:
Shrinking Professor is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

The player is a professor working in their laboratory, when the potion they are mixing slips from their grasp and spills. Suddenly a choking green fume overcomes the player, and when they wake up they have been transformed to less than one inch in height. The only way to regain their height is to get to the top of the laboratory table where there are crystals that will restore the player's original size.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature. The player starts in their basement, and must navigate their garden, a nearby stream, and the rooms of the house. The player must avoid dangers including spiders, birds, and other animals.
title: Shrinking Professor

description:
Howszat is a 2-player cricket game for the BBC Micro.

At the start of each game, the player must choose a name and position for all of their fielders. The bowler positions their fieldsmen around the playing area. The bowler then chooses from nine different shots: hook, cut, on drive, off drive, straight drive, leg glance, backward defensive, no shot, or forward defensive. The bowler also chooses their pace as fast, medium, or slow. The batsman will automatically answer the bowl, and the results of the play session are shown.
title: Howszat

description:
Bouncer is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a large circle of anti-matter while Space Bouncers jump about the screen. The player has to position the circle so that Space Bouncers land in the center of the circle and are destroyed. If the Space Bouncers are not perfectly centered, the anti-matter is destroyed. The player has a limited time to destroy all bouncers on the screen. If the player loses three lives it's game over.
title: Bouncer

description:
180! Darts is a 1–2 player sports game for the BBC Micro.

The player throws darts by moving a rapidly vibrating target left and right along the top and bottom of the dartboard. After releasing the dart, the player directs it up and down from a side perspective as the dart approaches the board. There are five levels of difficulty.

There are several game varieties: Normal, Round the Clock, Shanghai, and Noughts and Crosses.
title: 180! Darts

description:
Frogger is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a frog who moves in the cardinal directions, and tries to cross a busy street and river to reach the five open spaces at the top of the screen. The player has 30 seconds to complete each run, and must avoid cars that run horizontally across the bottom of the screen. When crossing the river, the player must avoid snakes, alligators, and avoiding landing in water or falling off the edge of the screen. After completing five successful crossings, the player enters a new level with faster-moving dangers.
title: Frogger

description:
Lunar Lander is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player takes control of a landing module that tries to touch down on a red landing site on the uneven lunar terrain. The vertical and horizontal speed of the module must be less than 10 m/s, and land at an angle of less that 6 degrees. As the player approaches the ground the screen zooms in, and the player has limited fuel to make a safe descent.

The player controls the engines and rate of spin of the module, and can modify engine output +20%, +10%, +1%, -1%, -10%, or hover. Rate of spin can be modified left or right by 1 or 5 degrees. There are four levels of difficulty, with the highest level having meteorites to avoid.
title: Lunar Lander

description:
Tower of Alos is a 1-player roleplaying game for the BBC Micro.

The valley was once ruled by a fair king called Alos. He built three strongholds in his land. One he gave to a young dragon called Temadra, another to his brother, and the last was left to his soldiers. Alos then built himself a large tower, 13 levels high. However, Alos became enraptured by black magic, which caused terrible damage to his land, ushering in an invasion of evil beings which crushed Alos' army, and threw the land into terror.

The player moves their character on a large map consisting of forests, the marsh, the Temple of Bragi, four towers, village, and the hoard. The player can buy healing potions at the village (up to nine at a time) and gold can be stored at the hoard. The brother's tower is a safe area where the player can regain hit points and gain experience levels. When entering any of the hostile towers the player fights multiple rounds of 10 monsters at a time. In the swamp, the player can enter burrows to find monsters or engage in random combat.

The player gains experience points and treasure from fighting monsters. When encountering enemies in the forest, the player can choose to attack or retreat. In combat, the player is surrounded by monsters and chooses which direction to attack. The player and enemies automatically take turns engaging. The more gold the player carries, the slower they will attack in a fight.

To complete the game, the player must reach level 7, clear Temadra's Den, The Garrison, The Temple of Bragi, and the Tower of Alos, as well as collecting four magic items and a boat, then returning to the safe castle.
title: Tower of Alos

description:
3D Convoy is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls the torpedo launcher aboard a battleship. The launcher moves left or right, and the fired torpedoes move slowly towards the horizon. Only one set of two torpedoes can be on the screen at a time. The goal is to destroy enemy vessels while avoiding incoming fire. The player starts with five lives, and can launch 30 torpedoes per life. If the player is hit by enemy fire they lose a life, but their torpedoes are replenished. More distant enemy vessels reward more points, and the player receives a 1,000-point bonus for hitting a loaded aircraft carrier.
title: 3D Convoy

description:
Jump-Jet is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a Harrier jump-jet from a side perspective as it tries to cross enemy territory and rendezvous with their aircraft carrier out at sea. The player controls their aircraft by using the throttle for vertical takeoff, and then maneuvering by lifting the nose up or down. In horizontal flight the throttle controls speed. The aircraft can fire straight forwards, and must regularly refuel at ground-based fueling depots.
title: Jump-Jet

description:
Gondor is a 1-player role-playing game for the BBC Micro.

Long ago, there was a powerful kingdom called Gondor. One day, evil forces arrived in the form of a Dark Lord from Mordor. The four heirlooms of the kingdom—the ring, helm, sword, and shield—were scattered far and wide, and the king's daughter was taken captive. There was one brave knight, Arthur, who set out on a quest to return the four items and rescue to princess. If successful, he will receive the hand of the princess and become heir to the throne.

The player explores a 4x4 map of the world, where each section contains a large map that the player can explore. The character has five statistics: speed, vision, power, defense, and hit points. Vision determines how far a player can see on the screen. The player moves by selecting a direction and how far to move. Attacking is also by selecting a direction. Enemies appear on the map and don't move. The player can move up to them and attack them, and receives damage if too close. Chests and random items appear on the screen. A wandering wizard can grant positive or negative statistic changes. The player can cast magic spells which can also modify statistics.

After collecting all four heirlooms, the player enters the second half of the game, where the player must get a crown from the city in the Enchanted Sector, and the princess must be rescued from the castle in Mordor. These are displayed as 3D mazes that the player explores. Keys to unlock the treasure in one area can be found in the other.
title: Gondor

description:
Wolfpack is a 1-player arcade space fighter for the BBC Micro.

The player has been commanded to destroy all enemy units in the four galaxies. The fleet consists of three Andromeda class Heavy Starcruisers and a single rotating Base. The three ships can be piloted individually, and the player switches control between vessels. All activity occurs in real time, and the non-active vessels continue to move. Individual ships have limited energy, which is used by all action commands. Ships can be rotated, accelerated, stopped, or fire lasers. A radar map shows all vessels in the current galaxy, and the player can warp between the four galaxies.

Enemy targets appear in the galaxy, and the player must hunt them down and destroy them. Energy can be harvested from the destroyed vessel, and brought back to the starbase. If the returning vessel is damaged on return the energy can be lost. A player ship is inactivated if its energy runs to 0, but it can be recovered by transferring energy to it. The goal is ultimately to destroy progressively more difficult enemy vessels in all four galaxies.
title: Wolfpack

description:
Kremlin is a 1-player 3D maze game for the BBC Micro.

The player navigates a large maze from a 1st-person perspective. The player can turn left, right, and move forwards. An overhead map is available to help navigation. The player has limited time to escape before a bomb goes off. The player can start on levels 1–8, with the goal to reach level 1 and the exit, although exits can be found on higher levels. A cash bonus is awarded for time remaining on exiting the maze.

Gremlins appear, and the player must shoot them to avoid being stung. Too many stings, and the player is transported back up one level.
title: Kremlin

description:
Missile Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

For several years, delicate talks with an aggressive enemy have been underway. Finally, these negotiations broke down, and full-scale thermonuclear war has ensued. The player is the fearless commander of one of the country's many advanced ABM defense systems, tasked with defending the six main centers of culture.

The player controls three missile defense turrets at the bottom of the screen. Each turret has 10 missiles per round, and the shot location is determined by moving the targeting cursor. The goal is to destroy incoming enemy missiles before they destroy the six cities at the bottom of the screen. Missile turrets that are hit are removed from the remainder of the round, but are rebuilt on the next level. Destroyed cities are removed for the rest of the game. It's game over when all six cities are destroyed. The player receives a bonus for remaining missiles and cities at the end of each round

Enemy ships also appear: Semi-Intelligent Drones which weave their way down in a sinusoidal pattern and destroy a large area when they hit, and Unintelligent Support Vessels, which fly in a horizontal path and take no evasive action.
title: Missile Attack

description:
Super Fruits is a 1-player, 3-reel slot machine game for the BBC Micro.

The player starts with 150 pence and it's 10 pence/spin on the slot machine. The player can earn holds, nudges, or even double or nothing on winning spins.
title: Super Fruits

description:
Sub Killer! is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a ship atop the water that moves left and right, while submarines race horizontally below. Submarines launch torpedoes that the player must avoid, while also dropping depth charges to try to hit the subs. If the player is hit three times it's game over. When all subs are destroyed the player moves on to the next more difficult level. The player can set game speed from 1–14.
title: Sub Killer!

description:
Proteanse is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Materializing on the unexplored oceanic planet Pelagova, the player is suddenly confronted by a horde of Proteans. These multiform creatures plunge down towards the player in suicidal attack waves while dropping lethal Grycon bombs. The player's ship moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically with laser cannons.

Enemy ships move randomly as they fall towards the bottom of the screen, returning firing towards the player. When a ship reaches the bottom of the screen it immediately jumps back to the top of the screen, and then descends more quickly. When all enemy ships are destroyed the player moves to a higher challenge. The player receives a time bonus on completing a level, and starts with three lives.
title: Proteanse

description:
Super-7 is a compilation of seven previously unreleased arcade game for the BBC Micro.

  • Bouncer: The player controls a vertically moving paddle at the right of the screen, and tries to deflect a bouncing ball back to the left. The player can miss the ball five times, and gains 100 points every time the ball hits the paddle or the top of the screen.
  • Chopper Chase: The player controls a helicopter that moves left, right, up and down, and can wrap around the left or right of the screen. The player tries to bomb tanks that come from the right and shoot an incoming airplane while avoiding falling bombs, striking the ground, or running into the plane.
  • Creatures of the Deep: A timed fishing game where the player moves their lure up and down to catch fish while avoiding jellyfish, garbage, and other unwanted catches.
  • Fire-Chief: Control a fire truck that can raise its rescue ladder to spray water and rescue people from burning buildings. The truck moves along the bottom of the screen, and can refuel and gather more water at the center of the screen.
  • Guns of Navarone: The player tries to defend their cliff-top stronghold with anti-aircraft fire from incoming helicopters, while also launches artillery shells at incoming destroyers. If a destroyer reaches the cliff, it detonates destroying the fortress.
  • Space Pilot Test: The player controls a space ship that moves in all directions, but can only fire to the left. The player has three lives to destroy continuously appearing alien spacecraft.
  • Space Rescue: Game play divided into two parts. First, the player controls a stationary craft in the center of the screen, and can fire in the cardinal directions to destroy incoming dangers. Second, the player controls a landing craft that picks up stranded astronauts at the bottom of the screen and delivers them to the safe area at the top. The player must avoid horizontally moving dangers.
title: Super-7

description:
April Showers is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a storm cloud, and tries to water a small flower in the center of the screen. The flower will rapidly wilt if not watered. The storm cloud has limited rain, and can be refilled by catching other clouds or raindrops. Umbrellas float by and, if they hit the player, they drain the water in the cloud. The goal is to keep the flower alive as long as possible. The player loses a life if their storm cloud runs dry, starting with three lives.
title: April Showers

description:
Mayday is a 1-player Lunar Rescue game for the BBC Micro.

While cruising around the solar system in their battleship, the player receives a distress call from the Mars base. The population has been ravaged by plague, and they desperately need extra medical supplies.

The player's mission is to launch from their mothership as it moves laterally across the top of the screen. The player must land on one of the two yellow landing pads, while avoiding asteroids that move horizontally across the screen. The player's landing craft moves left and right, and can engage thrusters to slow its descent to the surface.

After unloading the lander, the player must then head to the awaiting mothership once again. During the ascent the player must avoid horizontally moving alien vessels that drop bombs towards the surface. These can be shot by the player's craft. The player starts with three lives, and each successful return to the mothership changes the ground to a more difficult terrain.
title: Mayday

description:
Double Gold: The Alien from Outer Space plus Dragons Tooth is a package of two text adventures with graphics for the BBC Micro.

  • Dragons Tooth: The dragon’s tooth is the life-force of the curse on the southern lands. The aging wizard can destroy the legendary tooth, if someone finds it and takes it to him in his prison. The player must search for the tooth, doing battle with ogres, avoiding dangers, and solving a number of puzzles.

  • The Alien from Outer Space: As head scientist of the British Institute of Antarctic Research, it is the player's job to visit each station in British Antarctic Territory. The player has received an emergency call from Ian Davies. One of the six remaining scientists on the Antarctic base has been replaced by an alien lifeform. The player must explore the base and examine the behavioral patterns of the scientists, determine whom are alien, and destroy them.

sample_screenshots.caption: Dragons Tooth: Cabin in the Woods
The Alien from Outer Space: Starting the Adventure
The Alien from Outer Space: Additional Laboratory

title: Double Gold: The Alien from Outer Space plus Dragons Tooth

description:
10 Computer Hits is a compilation of 10 computer games for the BBC Micro.

  • Chuckie Egg
  • Eddie Kidd Jump Challenge
  • Felix in the Factory
  • Ghouls
  • Gisburne's Castle
  • Mr. Ee!
  • Sorcerer of Claymorgue Castle
  • Special Operations
  • Tales of the Arabian Nights
  • Tarzan
title: 10 Computer Hits

description:
10 Computer Hits 2 is a compilation of 10 previously-released games for the BBC Micro.

  • 3D Space Raiders
  • Circus
  • Evil Dead
  • Frenzy
  • Jet Boot Jack
  • Jet Power Jack
  • Kissin' Kousins
  • Smash and Grab
  • Star Striker
  • Web War
title: 10 Computer Hits 2

description:
10 Computer Hits 3 is a compilation of 10 previously-released games for the BBC Micro.

  • Battletank
  • Brian Jacks Superstar Challenge
  • Caesar the Cat
  • Danger UXB
  • Felix Meets the Evil Weevils
  • Manic Miner
  • Mine Shaft
  • Moonraider
  • Snooker
  • Wallaby
title: 10 Computer Hits 3

description:
Warlord of Doom is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Before the Warlord came, the valley was a place of peace and harmony. But then came the evil Warlord, who cast a spell over the inhabitants of the valley, and overnight the valley became a place of death. The people consulted with the druids and the mystics, who divined that the Warlord's soul and body had been separated, and that the soul must first be found and destroyed before the warlord could be defeated. The people of the valley chose Tumblestone, the greatest warrior the valley had ever produced, to be their savior.

The player controls Tumblestone as he explores the many locations around and inside the Warlord's castle. The player deals with knights, dragons, giants, mazes, and other dangers to try to complete their quest. All commands are via VERB NOUN entries. The program is divided into two parts, finding the Warlord's soul, and then defeating the Warlord himself. There is a save/restore feature.
title: Warlord of Doom

description:
Pengi is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Poor old Pengi is locked up in the freezer again. The player's job is to try to kill the snow-bees that live in the freezer before they kill Pengi. The snow-bees can be destroyed by kicking ice blocks into a snow-bee. They can also be killed by kicking the electric fence that surrounds the freezer to stun any snow-bees that are nearby, and then kicking the stunned snow-bee. The snow-bees can break down ice blocks, and if they touch Pengi, the player loses a life. When all snow-bees in a stage are killed, the player moves to a more challenging stage. Each level has three special diamond ice blocks that the player receives a bonus if they are lined up.
title: Pengi

description:
HuBert is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The Pharaoh has decreed that the pyramids need painting step-by-step. The player controls HuBert, who bounces about the isometric pyramid trying to paint all the parts. The player starts with three lives, and advances to the next level if all spaces are painted. If the player runs out of paint, falls off the pyramid, or touches an enemy, they lose a life. The player deals with the enemies Slick Sam, Ugg, Bouncy, Mad Mehul, and Coily, who chases the player unless enticed to fall off the edge.
title: HuBert

description:
Galaxy Raiders is a single-player, 1st-person space shooter for the BBC Micro.

The player has joined the elite band of Galaxy Raiders of the Terran Federation. Played from a 1st-person perspective, the player attempts to shoot and destroy the enemy spaceships of the Evil Arian Empire. The player chooses from four ranks, or difficulty levels, of game play. The enemies have three types of Arian ships: fighters, cruisers, and carriers.

The galaxy is separated into a 10 x 9 galaxy, and the player has access to a map which shows the location of space bases and enemy spaceships. The player can hyperspace between these zones. When in the same zone as an enemy ship, the enemy ship will try to escape, and the player can use their tracking radar to find it and destroy it. The player is armed with slow moving missiles and fast moving lasers. The player has limited energy which is used by firing their lasers, accelerating, and jumping into hyperspace. Energy is also drained by getting shot or running into asteroids. Energy can be restored at star bases. Enemy ships will try to destroy the player's star bases. The goal is to destroy all enemy ships.
title: Galaxy Raiders

description:
Digger is a 1-player Dig Dug clone for the BBC Micro.

The overworked allotment owner has to rid successive plots of increasing numbers of Red Footas and Green Pubars. The player moves through tunnels and digs underground, and can fire a short distance to the left or right to inflate and destroy enemies. Players can also drop rocks on enemies to defeat them. The enemy creatures move through tunnels, and can briefly turn into ghosts to move through rocks. If the player is caught by an enemy creature they lose a life. When all creatures are defeated the player moves to a challenge with more enemies.
title: Digger

description:
Demolator is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Following the Thousand Year War with the Alien Demolators, the last remnants of the human race are being transported across the galaxy in cryogenic stasis aboard the B.S. Quinn. However, the Demolators have invaded the cargo bay, and it is the player's job to destroy the Demolators and protect the human cargo.

The player controls the robot Xeno, directing its movements on two planes and firing an ultrasonic cannon to defend the remaining humans. Enemy Demolators race horizontally across the screen and pass over top of human cargo. Initially every seventh cargo they pass over is destroyed, and each level has an additional Demolator up to eight per level, and then this reduces to four, but they then destroy every sixth human cargo. Minors appear stationary on the screen, and later morph into mines than can not be removed. Protectors move about the screen and fire towards the player. Finally, the Trackor homes in on the player's position, and fires towards the player. The player clears a stage when all Demolators are destroyed, but destroyed humans persist between stages.
title: Demolator

description:
Galaxy Conflict is a computer-based board game for two players, in which the players have to manage all the resources with making war. The game comes with playing board and pieces, while the software helps with managing game play.

The object of the game is to defeat the opponent player and become ruler of the galaxy. The player has control of four Planetstations in four quadrants. Here, the player can construct or refurbish Eoncruisers, or improve the planetary F-Defense shields. The player also controls their individual Eoncruisers, where they can change course setting, activate their Velix Drive, set the F-Defense Shield, fire their Mesoguns, or activate the repair unit.
title: Galaxy Conflict

description:
Bun Fun is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is placed in charge of applying frosting and walnuts atop pastries as they travel along a conveyor belt. The goal is to activate the dispensers as the pastries move below the machines. For every correct pastry the player's salary is increased, but they're docked money for wasting toppings or pastries. Wasted cakes and toppings will accumulate and can jam the machine. Games last 1–5 minutes, and the player chooses from five different pastry speeds.
title: Bun Fun

description:
Row of Four is a 1-player versus computer Connect 4 game for the BBC Micro.

The player and computer take turns dropping pieces into a 7 x 6 board. Pieces fall into the lowest position in that column. The first player to score 4-in-a-row vertically, horizontally, or diagonally is the winner.
title: Row of Four

description:
Brick 'em in is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small character in a large playing field full of bricks. The player chooses to be chased by 1–9 people eaters at a speed of 1–9. The player can push blocks in the cardinal directions. The people eaters move continuously towards the player. The goal is to trap the people eaters so they can not move, and a level is completed by trapping all on-screen monsters.
title: Brick 'em in

description:
Zombie Island is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is chased by a number of zombies on a small island, with the goal of leading them into a pothole. The zombies chase directly after the player, who must avoid potholes, falling into the water, or getting caught by a zombie. The player has three lives, and gains points for moves made and zombies killed. When all zombies are defeated, the player moves to the next level with an additional zombie.
title: Zombie Island

description:
Grand Prix is a single-player, top-down car racing game for the BBC Micro.

The player races a computer opponent on a single track for 20 laps. Their car moves in the cardinal directions, and can speed up. The computer opponent has nine speed levels, and always follows the same path around the track. The game tracks how long the player has raced and how many laps they have completed. The race ends when the player hits a wall or the opponent vehicle.
title: Grand Prix

description:
J. R. is a 2-player resource management strategy game for the BBC Micro.

Each player controls an oil company and, on each turn, can perform research and development, explore, redrill, reprice their oil, alter workforce, or pass a turn. The goal is to find and drill for oil to sell on the market. Research and development lowers the cost of drilling and oil production. The player must manage the size and payroll of their workforce. The goal is to take control of the market and bankrupt their opponent. The player must compete with natural disasters and employee issues every few turns.
title: J. R.

description:
Cobra/Robo Swamp are two arcade games packaged together for the BBC Micro.

  • Cobra: The player controls a small snake that moves in the cardinal directions. Numbers appear on the playing area that count down. The player gains points by picking up these numbers. When a number is picked up, a new number appears on the screen and the snake elongates. It's game over if the snake hits the wall or its tail.

  • Robo Swamp: The player is chased by the robo-munchers on a swampy island. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and the robo-munchers move continuously towards the player. The player tries to lead the robo-munchers into the swamps on the island, while avoiding getting caught by a robo-muncher or falling into a swamp.
title: Cobra/Robo Swamp

description:
Frogger is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a frog who moves in the cardinal directions, and tries to cross a busy street and river to reach the five open spaces at the top of the screen. The player has limited time to complete each run, and must avoid cars that run horizontally across the bottom of the screen. When crossing the river, the frog must hop safely across logs and turtles that sometimes submerge below the water. The player must avoid alligators, falling into water, or moving off the edge of the screen. After completing five successful crossings, the player enters a new level with faster-moving dangers.
title: The Frog

description:
Galactic Intruders is a 1-player space-themed arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player must destroy the attacking waves of alien ships before they reach the player's planet. The player moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. Waves of enemy ships appear, and the player must destroy them all to proceed to the next round. Enemy ships can fire forwards or on angles. If the player loses three lives, it's game over.
title: Galactic Intruders

description:
World Cup Manager is a 1-player soccer management game for the BBC Micro.

The player takes control of one of 24 teams competing in the 1982 World Cup. The player names all positions, and is placed in one of six groups. The goal is to lead the team to World Cup victory.

The player can scout at least four teams before the tournament to get details about their play style. Prior to each game, the player sets their player position, defensive plan, attacking plan, midfield scheme, corners, and offensive and defensive free-kick plan. The game then automatically takes place, and all major moves are displayed in text with a final game score.
title: World Cup Manager

description:
Time Travel Adventure is a text-based adventure for the BBC Micro.

The player's goal is to travel through medieval fantasy lands to rescue the princess and find a way to return to modern times. Along the way, the player must solve numerous text puzzles, and defeat a dragon, dinosaur, magician, Dracula, and other dangers. Unusual for text adventures, the game automaps the areas the player has explored; this is lost when the player enters a new area. There is an inventory and list of commands, but no save/restore feature. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Time Travel Adventure

description:
Space Kingdom is a 1-player space-themed strategy game for the BBC Micro.

The player tries to take control of a galaxy consisting of 26 total planets. The player takes command of their fleet, starting on the planet Sol. Scouts can be sent out to investigate other planets. Fleet transports and fighters can be sent to other planets, and can conquer these planets with sufficient forces.

The player computer can be used to define distance between planets, determine list of independent planets and those owned by other empires, and status report of current fleets. The player can conscript troops and taxes from their conquered planets, and these can be used to contribute to player fleets. The player can also enter into suspended animation to skip an extended number of turns.
title: Space Kingdom

description:
Planet of the Aliens & Car Wars are two arcade games sold together for the BBC Micro.

  • Planet of the Aliens: As pilot of a Mark 3 space cruiser, the player has come across an alien planet swarming with nasties. The player controls a ship that moves horizontally across the screen, moving down 1 row each trip. The player drops bombs, which destroy several aliens directly below the target. The goal is to clear all the aliens before running into some of the standing creatures. There are 3 levels of difficulty.

  • Car Wars: Two cars race around a circular multilane track in opposite directions. The player and computer can move between lanes at 4 points on the track. The goal is to pick up all of the dots on the track without colliding with an enemy. Dots that the computer has run over are worth fewer points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Planet of the Aliens: Final Score
Planet of the Aliens: Difficulty Level

title: Alien Planet & Car Wars

description:
Black Queen is a 1-player contract bridge program and game for the BBC Micro.

The player, their dummy, and 2 computer opponents compete in contract bridge. Bidding and playing are divided into two separate rounds played independently. Instructions and catalogue can be viewed independently, and games can be saved in-process.
title: Black Queen

description:
Canyon Battle is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is the pilot of a small biplane, and the sole remaining defender of the little mountain kingdom of Asdel. An armada of tyrannical robotic Xarian attack craft are approaching through the narrow gorge that leads to Asdel.

The player's biplane is fitted with a single micro-shell canyon, and the player, trapped between the steep jagged walls of a canyon, must defeat the slow moving Xarian craft. The biplane moves left, right, forwards, and backwards, as the canyon and enemies scroll from the bottom of the screen. The player must avoid hitting walls, enemy craft, or getting shot down by enemy fire. The goal is to survive 24 canyons, and shoot down two out of three Xarian crafts.
title: Canyon

description:
Pantry Antics is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a mouse that moves left and right on a 5-shelf pantry that scrolls and loops horizontally. The mouse can jump or fall between levels at gaps between the shelves. On the shelves are saucers and cups, and the mouse knocks the items one shelf lower if it touches them. The player has 99 time units to try to knock all items off the lowest shelf, breaking everything. After breaking everything, the player must find the cheese hidden on the level. On each level is a different animal that threatens the mouse. First, birds which fly along shelves, then frogs which jump between levels. Next comes cats and then bats. If the player beats all 4 stages, then they repeat with the enemies moving 1.5x faster. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Pantry Antics

description:
White Knight Mk 11 is a single-player chess program played versus the computer for the BBC Micro.

Chess pieces are displayed on the screen, and commands are submitted via the keyboard. The player can toggle black/white and clear squares. The player can move forwards or backwards one move, set clocks, invert the board, and play invisible chess. There are four modes of game play.
title: White Knight Mk 11

description:
White Knight Mk 12 is a 1- or 2-player chess program played versus the computer for the BBC Micro; it is the sequel to White Knight Mk 11.

Chess pieces are displayed on the screen, and commands are submitted via the keyboard. The player can toggle black/white and clear squares. The player can move forwards or backwards one move, set clocks, invert the board, and play invisible chess. There are four modes of game play, and the computer can be set to play itself.
title: White Knight Mk 12

description:
Fun Games is a compilation of four early games for the BBC Micro.

  • Breakout: The player controls a long or short moving paddle horizontally at the bottom of the screen. The goal is to bounce a ball to break the bricks at the top of the screen without letting the ball fall off the bottom..
  • Dodgems: Two carts move in opposite directions on a circular track. The player can move 1 or 2 lanes at the 4 spaces on the track. The goal is to collect all the dots on the screen without hitting the computer vehicle.
  • Flash: Memory game where the player tries to repeat a progressively longer four color sequence.
  • Snake: The player controls a progressively elongating snake, and tries to pick up letters that appear on the screen. The snake moves in the cardinal directions, and it's game over if the player touches the wall or their tail.
title: Arcade Action

description:
Games of Strategy is four strategy games for the BBC Micro.

  • Galaxy: The player is placed in command of the Starship Endeavour, tasked with ridding the galaxy of the Kryon Fleet. The player controls the ship's warp drive, long range sensors, phasers, torpedoes, shield control, and short range scan.
  • Gomoku: Played on a 20 x 20 board against the computer, the players take turns placing a marker with the goal to get 5 in a row.
  • Masterbrain: The player and computer try to solve a 4 number code. Each guess, the player is told how many numbers are correct, and in the correct position.
  • Reversi: Also known as Othello, the player competes against a computer or human opponent on an 8 x 8 board. The aim is to fill the board with as many pieces of their own color as possible by flanking the opponent's pieces to capture them and reverse their color.
title: Games of Strategy

description:
Arcade Adventure is a series of arcade games with simplified controls designed for children with disabilities.

  • Brickout: A ball travels along the bottom of the screen, and the player chooses when to release it vertically upwards. Bricks that have no bricks below them can be outright destroyed. Other bricks can be damaged if hit, but will only drop when bricks below are removed. The player's goal is to eliminate all flower pots. Extra time is awarded by destroying green bricks.
  • Shocker: The player moves around the edges of a fish tank trying to avoid electric eels and blue reptiles at the edge of the screen. The goal is to select parts of the tank by moving their controller.
  • Toboggan Run: Side-scrolling arcade game where the player can move vertically, while trying to move between flags. The player must avoid dogs and other dangers. The player controls game speed and width between flags.
  • War of the Worlds: An arcade game where the player controls a gun at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally, fires vertically, and tries to destroy incoming alien vessels while avoiding enemy fire. The player controls enemy speed, fire rate, and controls.
title: Arcade Adventure

description:
Arcade Challenge is a series of arcade games with simplified controls designed for children with disabilities.

  • Bomber: The player tries to drop bombs on a target as their plane flies across the top of the screen. The player gets 10 bombs per game. The player controls bomber speed, bomber height, and target size.
  • Break Out: The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen, and bounces a ball to break blocks at the top of the screen.
  • Grouse Shooting: The player moves their gunsight to shoot birds. There are 3 birds in each game.
  • Rapids: The player moves their boat laterally at the bottom of the screen, and must avoid running into the shore as the screen moves from above. The player controls river width, speed, and number of rocks.
  • Space Cat: The player rotates their feline spaceship to shoot space mice. The player has 1000 gallons of fuel to shoot the mice. The player controls game speed, number of asteroids and automatic firing.
  • Squash: The player moves a paddle laterally at the top of the screen, and gains a point by bouncing a ball at the bottom of the screen and loses a life if it hits the top.
title: Arcade Challenge

description:
Asteroid Miner is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small space mining vessel, with the goal of collecting green asteroids. Red asteroids provide no benefit. The player can only collect an asteroid in the scoop at the front of their vessel and, if they hit an asteroid any other way, their ship is destroyed. Another mining vessel also creates danger for the player. Points are awarded after docking with the base at the bottom center of the screen to deposit collected green asteroids. There are 10 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with three ships.
title: Asteroid Miner

description:
Pentiles is a 1-player puzzle game for the BBC Micro.

The player attempts to score points by covering a red target zone using puzzle pieces that always contain five blocks. The target always contains 60 red blocks, but can be set to a depth of 3–6, which determines the width of the target zone. Blocks can be rotated before being placed on the target, but once their rotation is set can not be further rotated. Blocks can move in all directions, but once a block is placed in the target zone, new blocks can not be moved over this location.

There are three skill levels, and a level proceeds until all available pentiles are used, the target zone is filled, or the remaining target zone can not be reached by a pentile. Final score is based upon individual bonus pentiles, with higher scoring pentiles having thicker walls. Bonuses are also awarded if all eight pentile shapes are used, the target is entirely filled, and for the remaining time for the level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Filling the Target Zone with Depth of 4

title: Pentiles

description:
Reversi is a 1-player board game for the BBC Micro.

Also known as Othello, the player competes against the computer on an 8 x 8 board. The aim is to fill the board with as many pieces of their own color as possible by flanking the opponent's pieces to capture them and reverse their color. There are five levels of computer opponent. The player can review computer moves, and can set a randomizer to ensure the computer plays differently during the first few turns.
title: Reversi

description:
Honeybug is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player helps protect a beehive by defending it from weevils, placing different bees, and killing runaway larva. At the beginning of a level, the player is given the number of grubs and honey cells they're required to fill to complete the level. The player fills sections of nest and honeycomb.

The player controls a probe, that can select from different eggs at the bottom of the screen. These eggs can be empty, contain dangerous weevils, or include bees that can be placed in the hive. If a weevil appears, the player must search the periphery of the screen for a letter, and press it, before the weevil damages the hive. Bees can include drones, soldiers, grubs, queens, and workers, which have a different influence on the hive. Runaway larva block the path of the probe and prevent the placement of more bees. If the bottom row fills with larva the player can not place more bees, and the game is over. There are three skill levels.
title: Honeybug

description:
Haunted House is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

As the sole living heir of Arnold J. Harbuthnot, the player has been tasked with entering a haunted mansion to find six treasures and rescue a princess. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and the player must deal with drunks, wolves, vicious dogs, and monsters during their adventure.
title: Haunted House

description:
Passport to Death is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

As an astronaut from the planet Zandra, the player has been sent to Earth. Upon crash landing, the player must find their spaceship, extra fuel, radio transmitter, and the other items required to return safely home. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Passport to Death

description:
Island of Xaan is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

The player has found themself personally sentenced to life in jail by the King of Xaan for stealing water. The player must escape the prison, and then explore the island to find the items needed to make a disguise. After making a disguise, the player must look for the treasures required to bribe an escape off the island.

There is a save/restore feature, and the maximum score is 250 points.
title: Island of Xaan

description:
Beeline is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Hank is no ordinary bee: He's blue, and when he gets angry he explodes. Hank moves left and right, flies upwards, and sinks down when not flying. On each level, the player must collect all the pollen grains, flowers, apples, honey pots, and bowls of water to open the door to the next level.

The player must avoid dangers, including: toadstools, lizards, spiders, insecticide, and trackers. Hank's goal is to return to his beehive, and has separate energy and anger bars. When Hank touches a wall or other dangers his anger increases. Anger decreases when Hank is resting. When the player touches dangers their energy decreases, which can be replaced by picking up more items. The player starts with three lives.
title: Beeline

description:
Banjax is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Legend has it that any bear intelligent enough to reach the Inner Sanctum of the Golden Temple shall become the Lord of Mystery. The player controls Banjax, who moves in the cardinal directions between a number of fixed screens avoiding enemies and picking up items. If Banjax is touched by an enemy he is brought back to a reincarnation point, which initially is the starting screen, but the location can be changed by the player. The type and number of enemies on a screen are randomized every time a player enters. The player starts their adventure with 5 lives.
title: Banjax

alternate_titles.title: Blood of the Mutineers: A Captain Blizzard Adventure

description:
Blood of the Mutineers is a 1-player text adventure for the BBC Micro.

While in search of the treasure of the Great Skull Temple on the Island of Sculeo, Captain Blizzard is overthrown by his mutinous crew. The player's goal is to escape the ship unscathed to reach the island. There, they must find the treasure and safely escape. All commands are via text entry, and there is a save/restore feature.
title: Blood of the Mutineers

description:
Acnean Mutoids is a 1-player strategy game for the BBC Micro.

Waking up from stasi-sleep, the player finds that their interstellar cruiser has been invaded by an evil race known as the Acneans. The player must avoid the blood-dripping mutoids to activate the ship's self-destruct computer, the only thing that can save the planet Earth.

The game is player from a top-down perspective, with the ship displayed on the screen. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and randomly encounters Acneans as well as hidden weapons. The goal is to find the key to unlock the room to the self-destruct computer, and then destroy the ship. The player can locate a matter disassembler that allows a single destruction of a wall piece. Weapons have a specified weight, and the player can hold a maximum of 120 Astrograms. When encountering an Acnean, the player has several chances to try to defeat the alien. If they fail, they lose a weapon. If the player encounters an Acnean while unarmed they are killed.
title: Acnean Mutoids

description:
Funfair is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a gun that moves horizontally at the side of the screen, while trying to hit a series of horizontally-moving targets. The goal on each level is to clear the screen of ducks, rabbits, and teddy bears. The player has a limited number of bullets each level, so must shoot carefully.

Occasionally ducks will release from their pegs and fly down. If they reach the bottom of the screen they eat five bullets. If a duck is hit in the body it is destroyed, but if shot in the wing it descends faster. Extra bullets can be gained by shooting the numbers that scroll past or shooting the bullets that appear in the special box to the left of the screen. To prevent more ducks from joining the rows the player must shoot the bell at the right of the screen by hitting the slider below it.

If a level is cleared, then the player enters a bonus screen where the player must shoot through moving screens. Each level has faster-moving enemies.
title: Funfair

description:
Fruity Freddy is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Freddy's job is to pick all the fruit in Mr. Meano's back garden without being killed. The planted seeds grow up into flowers which eventually produce fruit. The player completes a level if they pick all the fruit, but if a piece of fruit becomes too ripe it explodes, spreading four more seeds onto the screen. If Mr. Meano sees the player pick a plant before it bears fruit he will emerge from his house and chase the player.

The player must also avoid the bees which emerge from Mr. Meano's beehive. These can be temporarily warded off by grabbing a can of DDT. The crazy Crimson Caterpillar also crawls across the screen, and the sparrow releases deadly droppings from the top of the screen which must be avoided. The player must complete each level before the bonus score reaches 0. Various bonus candies appear on the screen to be picked up for additional points. The player loses a life if hit by a danger, and starts with three lives.
title: Fruity Freddy

description:
3D-Golf is a 1-player sports game for the BBC Micro.

Played from a first-person perspective, the player chooses the club and the direction they wish to shoot the golf ball. The direction is chosen by moving a cursor left or right. The player must contend with trees, water, sand traps, and out of bounds. The wind direction is displayed by the direction the flag is blowing on the green. All clubs are used at full power except for the pitching wedge, where the player chooses from a power of 1 to 100. On the green the player putts, and the direction of the green is displayed in the horizon. The player selects the power of their putt from 1 to 100.
title: 3D-Golf

description:
3D-Tennis is 1–2 player tennis game for the BBC Micro.

Played from a fixed perspective, two players move horizontally at the back edges of the tennis court. The ball is returned by aligning the tennis racquet with the incoming ball. The game supports out of bounds, but not hitting the net. Follows the point scoring rules of tennis.
title: 3D-Tennis

description:
Box of Treasures is an educational game for children on the BBC Micro.

A collection of educational programs based on the theme of boxes, it contains an adventure where the player must rescue Henry the Prince of Fools by having him transformed into a frog by the wizard. The player travels to a number of locations on a scrolling 4 x 4 map. At each location the player can pick up an item, or use their item to gain a clue or other item. It contains a small 3D maze that the player navigates by choosing to go left, straight, or right.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find a Rope Along the Beach

title: Box of Treasures

description:
Skyhawk is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Colleagues from the player's special operations unit are close to annihilation. From their defeat will be born the most terrifying threat the planet has ever known. As the sole surviving chopper pilot, the player must cross open ground from shelter to sentry.

The player controls a a helicopter than can fire forwards or drop bombs. The player must avoid tanks that fire along the ground and planes that circle and fire towards the player. Soldiers exit shelters and run along the ground. The player must land and pick up soldiers, and then transport them back to the starting point. A 25 second timer counts down, but is refilled when soldiers are rescued. The player is destroyed by barrage balloons if time runs out. The player starts with three lives.
title: Skyhawk

description:
The Acornsoft Hits: Volume 2 is a compilation of four previously-released games for the BBC Micro.

  • Arcadians
  • Labyrinth
  • Meteors
  • Starship Command
title: The Acornsoft Hits: Volume 2

description:
100 Programs for the BBC Microcomputer is a guide to programming for the BBC Micro.

The guidebook contains a variety of programs and games that can be typed into the BBC Micro to help teach the reader programming skills. Contains the following sections:

  • Introduction
  • Games
  • Business
  • At Home
  • Painting on the Screen
  • Data Handling Programs
  • Recreation
  • The Science Lab
  • Mathematics
  • Programs for the School
title: 100 Programs for the BBC Microcomputer

description:
Black Box and Gambit are two strategy games for the BBC Micro.

  • Black Box: A 1–4 player game where 4–5 atoms are hidden within an 8 x 8 grid. Players take turns firing a ray into the grid and observing the exit point. When a player believes they have determined all atom positions, they can mark them on the screen. Once all players have marked their atoms, their true position is displayed and points are awarded.

  • Gambit: 1–4 player game on a 15 x 15 board. The goal is to move both characters to the center holding area from the far corner. Each turn, the player can position one barricade on the board that blocks opponent characters, but allows theirs to pass. The player rolls two dice, and their character can move in the cardinal directions, and must move the distance of one of the dice. The dice moves can be split between two characters or just one character. The first player to move both characters to safety is the winner.

sample_screenshots.caption: Black Box: Choosing an Atom Position

title: Black Box and Gambit

description:
The Seventh Star is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Travelling back to Earth from a starbase in the distant Andromeda Nebula, the player crash-lands on the surface of a strange planet known as the Seventh Star. The player manages to salvage a few items from the wreckage, including the handheld microcomputer Mu-Mu. They must try to survive on the planet long enough to find a way to return to Earth. As they explore a large alien city they encounter a number of strange creatures and inhabitants. The game contains numerous jokes and references to contemporary science fiction movies.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry, and there is a save restore feature. Maximum score is 100 points.
title: The Seventh Star

description:
Gateway to Karos is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

As a local historian, the player has been allowed access into the great library of Karoway Manor. There, between the pages of an ancient book, the player found a seemingly much older sheet of paper. It told of a stone gateway to the mythical land of Karos, opening only at midnight on the summer solstice. Were it not for the majestic stone arch in the center of the manor lawn, and that it was now dusk on Midsummer's Day, the player may have not given it another thought. The player enters the land of Karos, and must explore the mysterious Island of Karos. There, they must retrieve the mysterious Talisman of Khoronz , and return safely back home again.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry, and there is a save restore feature. Maximum score is 100 points. The player starts with 1,000 health points which decrease as the player encounters dangers on the island.
title: Gateway to Karos

description:
Spooky Manor is a 1–4 player text adventure for children for the BBC Micro.

For over 100 years the old manor house has been empty. It is said to be haunted and to contain hidden treasure. One day the player sets out with their friends to explore the house and solve the mystery. While looking around the house, the front door slams shut, trapping the friends inside. Night is approaching.

The screen is divided into four separate text screens, and the players can interact with each other. The player must search the house looking for treasures, and try to escape. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and each player receives an individual score.
title: Spooky Manor

description:
Infinity is a 1-player science fiction-themed arcade game with adventure elements for the BBC Micro.

Crash landing on the fourth planet of the Inferium System after being sent adrift by mutineers, the player finds themself on the planet Infinity. The inhabitants of Infinity are a hungry, thieving bunch, but the player can barter and trade with them. The player has discovered the existence of an old disused radio telescope on a far island, and must find and repair the telescope to contact Earth to get a ride home.

Played from a side view, the player can move left, right, up, or down, jump, pick up, drop, and use items. The player must find and use a number of items to complete a multitude of puzzles, has limited health, and must avoid or defeat the various enemies they encounter.
title: Infinity

description:
The Complete Home Entertainment Centre is a collection of table and board games for the BBC Micro.

  • Backgammon
  • Bridge
  • Chess
  • Dominoes
  • Poker
  • Pontoon
  • Wordsearch
title: The Complete Home Entertainment Centre

description:
Staircase Stampede is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player guides Humphrey up and down stairs trying to paint all of the steps on each level. Played from an isometric perspective, the player moves in four directions, and has to be careful not to fall off the stairs.

The player must avoid Horrible Harold, who moves relentlessly up and down the stairs. Starting on level 3, Helpful Horace will clean off steps that have been painted, and is deadly if the player runs into him. On higher levels, bombs appear, and the player must move onto that square to defuse the bomb before it's too late. Finally, Humphrey must avoid the boot, which relentlessly follows the player.

The player starts with four lives, and gains a life every four levels completed. If time runs out before completing a level, it's game over.
title: Staircase Stampede

description:
Street Patroller is a text adventure for the BBC Micro and Electron.

Paul I. Grace, the everyday street policeman, has been accused of being part of a conspiracy to steal the Royal jewels, and has been given only the three weeks by the police chief to solve the crime and clear his name. The adventure starts with the events leading up to the theft, and then include the player's quest to clear their name. The player must explore the streets of London as well as the surrounding countryside to try to bring the true thieves to justice.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The player needs to sleep regularly during their adventure, and time passes with every turn used. There is an in-game hint system.
title: Street Patroller

description:
It's Magic is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

Starting as a high school student, the player's goal is to gain membership of the International Union of Magicians. The adventure is divided into two parts. In the first part, the player must travel through their hometown and the surrounding area gathering a variety of magic spells to use on their quest. In the second part, the player uses these magic spells to gain entry to the magic society.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry,
title: It's Magic

description:
Cosmic Fighter is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The play controls a spaceship at the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally and fires vertically. Waves of alien vessels approach from the top of the screen and move towards the bottom. The player's goal is to destroy all alien vessels before they reach the bottom. Any ships that reach the bottom force the player to start higher on the screen in proceeding waves. The player has limited fuel, consumed by movement and firing. The player loses a life if they run out of fuel or are hit by alien vessels. Every five levels the player has a chance to refuel by shooting a mothership and then docking with it. The player starts with three lives.
title: Cosmic Fighter

description:
Street Patroller Remix is a text adventure for the BBC Micro. It features a similar story to the original Street Patroller, but all locations and plot points have been changed.

Paul I. Grace, the everyday street policeman, has been accused of being part of a conspiracy to steal the Royal jewels, and has been given only the three weeks by the police chief to solve the crime and clear his name. The adventure starts with the events leading up to the theft, and then include the player's quest to clear their name. The player must explore the streets of London as well as the surrounding countryside to try to bring the true thieves to justice.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The player needs to sleep regularly during their adventure, and time passes with every turn used. There is an in-game hint system.
title: Street Patroller Remix

description:
Magic Adventure is a text adventure designed for children on the BBC Micro.

The king has lost his magic jar, and the player must return it in exchange for two tickets to the fairy castle. The player can visit a total of 10 locations by pressing the function keys. At these locations, the player solves simple puzzles or answers yes/no questions. The player designs and names their own character, as well as their friend.
title: Magic Adventure

description:
F for Freddie is a 1-player strategy game for the BBC Micro.

The player takes control of a large passenger jet, and is responsible for flying routes between airports. Played from a large menu, the game uses 36 separate control keys to modify their plane's status. The player can control individual passenger and cargo doors, runway conditions, undercarriage, individual engine power, autopilot, flaps, rudder, fuel, and approach. The player must load and unload passengers, and fly the plane by setting control options.
title: F for Freddie

description:
Turbo is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a race car from a perspective behind the vehicle. The player can accelerate, decelerate, and move left or right. The player must avoid incoming vehicles, and loses speed if they touch the side of the racetrack. The player can get hit from behind if they drive too slowly. If the player gets hit three times, its game over. The player receives a high score for how far they drive.
title: Turbo

description:
Jigsaw is a 1-player puzzle game for the BBC Micro.

The player tries to put together jigsaw puzzles. There are eight possible images, and five levels of difficulty ranging in size from 3 x 3 – 12 x 12. Pieces can be moved, and the next piece can be requested at any time. The player can view the final image at any time, and the total time to solve the puzzle is calculated.
title: Jigsaw

description:
Swords and Sorcery is a 1-player roleplaying game for the BBC Micro.

In the far away land of Irium, the princess cast a spell of banishment on the wicked sorcerer Brogfelt. Just before being struck, he managed to reverse the spell, turning the princess into a diamond. Brogfelt found sanctuary within the Dungeons of Terror, and broke the diamond into four parts, hiding them amongst the monsters of the dungeon. The King, distraught, has offered half his land to anyone who can retrieve the four crystals. The player has approached the King who has offered three prisoners to serve as their companion as they enter the dungeon themselves.

The player receives three randomly generated characters defined by strength, magic ability, carrying weight, and treasure. There are nine levels of game difficulty, and the player is given the location of the four crystals at the beginning of the adventure. All commands are via text entry, and the player can move north, south, east, west, up, and down. Treasure items can be picked up to increase final score. Potions offer benefits to characters. During combat, the player automatically wins or loses a fight, losing one character in a failed combat.
title: Swords and Sorcery

description:
Five Spheres of Goliath is a science fiction-themed text adventure for the BBC Micro.

It is the year 2150 A.D., and the human race has ventured into deep space in search of new worlds to colonize. Vast ships, thousands of meters in length, are being constructed many miles above the Earth's surface. These ships serve another purpose however. As well as functioning as research vehicles, others are used to transport dangerous criminals to distant prisons built on planets many light-years from Earth.

The player is a prisoner on the Goliath. Over two miles long, the ship has long since left the Earth's solar system on its long journey to Gamma Minor, an icy, alien world on the very edge of space. The cell in which the player has been held the last three months is small, cramped, and uncomfortable. Even at 20 times the speed of light, the journey will take many more months. One morning, however, the player awakes to find the ship at rest and no other sign of human activity. The Goliath has been abandoned. The player must escape from their prison cell and find the reason for the apparent abandonment.
title: Five Spheres of Goliath

description:
Reversi is a 1-player-versus-computer board game for the BBC Micro.

The player competes against a computer opponent on an 8 x 8 board. The aim is to fill the board with as many pieces of their own color as possible by flanking the opponent's pieces to capture them and reverse their color. Either the player or computer can make the first move.
title: Reversi

description:
Jingle Bells: A Sleigh Ride with Father Christmas is a Christmas-themed adventure game for the BBC Micro.

Father Christmas has invited the player to help sort out presents, but unfortunately he can not find the way back to the player's home. The player must explore the North Pole to find the things Santa needs to deliver presents and find their home again, or else there may be no presents this year.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The maximum score is 60 points.
title: Jingle Bells: A Sleigh Ride with Father Christmas

description:
The Lost Slipper is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

It is the morning after the ball. Prince Charming is very upset because he has lost the glass slipper. The player has been tasked to find the slipper, a pearl necklace, and the Prince's lucky horseshoe, and give all these to Cinderella.

All commands are via VERB NOUN command. Locations are visually displayed on the screen. The goal is to reach the maximum score of 214 points.
title: The Lost Slipper

description:
The Mad Painter is a text adventure divided into four parts for the BBC Micro.

As the player tours an old house, the guide mentions that it once belonged to a mad painter who painted pictures which changed mysteriously in the night. One long-ago night, the painter disappeared. Since that time, there have been tales of people vanishing while in the house.

The guide mentions that a chimney sweep and his master once disappeared from the very same fireplace in the room the tour is in now. Intrigued by this, as the tour moves on, the player walks into the fireplace.

The player thus enters a four-part adventure, where they must solve the Mystery of the Mad Painter, meeting many of his victims who disappeared in the house over the last two centuries.

There is a save/restore feature, and each of the four parts have a maximum score. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: The Mad Painter

description:
Cute to Kill: Beyond Infinity - Chapter II is a side scrolling shooter for the BBC Micro.

Commander Slie has been ordered to take his team of mercenaries to put down a rebellion on the planet Cute. However, just before being teleported to the surface, their ship was struck by a missile and the team ended up teleported to an old military base—the very heart of the alien unrest.

The player can move left, right, and jump, and obtains progressively stronger weapons as they move between areas of the alien base. The game play area is divided into a number of static screens, and the player moves between them, but can also teleport to different areas. The player has limited energy, and it's game over if this runs out.

The player has 30 minutes to defeat the eight alien bosses and escape the military base before it's nuked from orbit.
title: Cute to Kill: Beyond Infinity - Chapter II

description:
Froglet is a 1-player Frogger clone for the BBC Micro.

The player attempts to navigate a frog across a busy highway and a river while avoiding being hit by cars or falling into the water. Turtles and logs cross horizontally in the river, and turtles will periodically dive beneath the water. The player starts with four lives and, on each level, the player has limited time to fill all four homes at the top of the screen. If all four are filled, the player advances to a more difficult level.
title: Froglet

description:
Pete the Plastered Postman and Asteroid Lander are two arcade games released together for the BBC Micro.

  • Asteroid Lander: A Lunar Lander variant, where the player tries to position a spacecraft on a small landing pad at the bottom of the screen while gravity pulls the craft downwards. The craft can fire thrusters, and rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, and has limited fuel. There are three difficulty levels which determine the number of obstacles to avoid.

  • Pete the Plastered Postman: Pete must deliver parcels to the red rectangle at the top of the screen while avoiding the dog that chases him. After a successful deliver, he must return to the red pillar box at the bottom of the screen to pick up another parcel. Because Pete likes to oblige the whisky bottle, the player's movements are hampered, and the character often moves in the opposite direction or usually just sways in place. The player gains 100 points for each parcel delivered, and loses one point for every bite. Time limit is 10 minutes.
title: Pete the Plastered Postman and Asteroid Lander

description:
Gulp! is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Ernie the lion tamer has been challenged to set a new world record for plunging his head into the lions' mouths. Unfortunately, Ernie has fallen out with the boss, and the lions are looking a little peckish over the last few days.

Ernie tries to climb four levels of danger, with a ladder present on each end. Ernie can move left, right, climb up and down ladders, and jump over rats and snakes as they slither across the screen. Sixteen lions, four on each row, are present. These lions mostly have their mouths open, but sometimes close them. To pass a lion, Ernie must either pass while the lion's mouth is closed, or stick his head in the lion's mouth before moving past. If the lion closes its mouth while Ernie is in position, then Ernie loses his head. Numerous small creatures must be jumped over, or the player can stand on the lion platforms to let them past.

There are five levels of game difficulty, which effect game speed, how often the lions close their mouth, and the number of enemies.
title: Gulp!

description:
Ledge Man is a 1-player arcade platformer for the BBC Micro.

After Ledge Man arrives home from the village auction with his bargain of the day, a Victorian bureau, he discovers a map in a dusty drawer. The map gives directions to a hidden cave where precious stones can be gathered in abundance. The map warns of perilous guardians, including: sentient barrels, meteor storms, and wandering nasties. Armed with his trusty umbrella, Ledge Man sets off to gather the treasure.

Ledge Man can jump, move left and right, and climb up and down ladders. He must jump between platforms, trying to collect all the flashing gems on each stage. Conveyor belts and moving platforms add to the difficulty. The umbrella can help him safely fall long distances. The player has limited time to complete each level, and starts with three lives. There are a total of eight stages, and three difficulty levels.
title: Ledge Man

description:
Crypt Capers is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

One day, while studying ancient Egyptian ruins, the player discovers an unknown pyramid buried in the sands of the Sahara. Once inside, the player must try to collect all the treasures, including: statues, old jars, papyrus, and masks. On each level the goal is to gather all the keys and reach the exit door to the next level, while avoiding dangerous snakes, fireballs, and ghosts.
