The player moves in the cardinal directions, and can fire their gun forwards. Dangers appear in their chamber, and then roam the halls.

Each level must be completed before time runs out. The player starts with three lives, and receives an additional life for every 30,000 points or four levels completed. The goal is to reach the Pharos chamber on level 12.
title: Crypt Capers

description:
Ewgeebeez is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship that travels in the cardinal directions. The ship can fire directly forwards, and must explore a large maze in search of the 12 crystals needed to escape. Numerous enemies appear as the player explores the maze, plus some larger dangers that threaten the player. After collecting all 12 crystals, the player must navigate to the exit point. The player starts with three lives, and loses a life if they touch an enemy.
title: Ewgeebeez

description:
Legion Adventure is a text adventure for the BBC Micro set in the ancient Roman Empire.

Playing as a Roman Centurion, the player starts in Rome where they must explore the ancient city to gain treasure to win Caesar's favor. After winning Caesar's favor, the player is tasked with going to Egypt to find a famous treasure and bringing it to safety.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The player scores points for a variety of tasks. There is a save/restore feature.
title: Legion Adventure

description:
Sentinel is a 1-player Tempest clone for the BBC Micro.

In a far quadrant of Space Sector 4 are the compressed single-dimension gateways to the anti-matter world of Migon.

The player controls a spaceship that can rotate clockwise or counterclockwise around the 16 spaces on the outside of a square. The ship fires towards the center, and tries to destroy incoming enemy vessels before they reach the peripheries of the level. Some enemy vessels rotate around the peripheries of the level threatening the player. Once per level, the player can fire their Star Smasher, which destroys all enemies on the screen. At the end of each level, the player must avoid meteors that stream towards the edges of the screen. The player starts with three lives.
title: Sentinel

description:
Secta Invaders is a 1–2 player Space Invaders clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally left and right and fires vertically. A large group of alien vessels move horizontally to the edge of the screen, move down one row, and reverse direction. There are three large shields to protect the player from incoming alien vessels. The player tries to destroy all enemy vessels before they reach the bottom of the screen. The player loses a life if hit by enemy fire. New walls appear after every third wave of invaders destroyed.
title: Secta Invaders

description:
The Land of Chark is a fantasy text adventure for the BBC Micro.

The player explores the medieval fantasy land of Chark in a quest to return the lost treasure to the King. During their adventure they encounter numerous dangers, including: a wight, a dragon, a troll, and the Balron. The player has limited stamina, which can be lost during monster encounters. Stamina can be restored by eating or drinking.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: The Land of Chark

description:
Star Clash is a 1-player 1st person science-fiction shooter for the BBC Micro.

As a galactic 'minder', the player has been hired to protect the star cruiser carrying the Emperor. The player must follow the Emperor through numerous star-gates that lead to further galaxies. Each star-gate is protected by galactic customs officers who have orders to destroy all unauthorized star cruisers.

After every three star zones, the player has the chance to shoot star capsules, which customs officers will try to escape from, and must be destroyed.
title: Star Clash

description:
Asteroid Belt is a 1-player Asteroids clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small spaceship that can rotate 360 degrees, thrust, and fire forwards. Asteroids appear on the screen, which when hit break into two smaller pieces, and then two even smaller pieces, until being entirely destroyed. The player can hyperspace to a random screen location when in danger. New asteroids appear when all items on the screen are destroyed. Alien UFOs appear, which fire in random directions.
title: Asteroid Belt

description:
Rubik's Cube is a puzzle game where the player attempts to solve a 3 x 3 Rubik's Cube graphically displayed on the screen.

All sides of the cube are displayed simultaneously, and player types in letter commands to rotate sections.
title: Rubik's Cube

description:
Space Hawks is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. Alien vessels move as a group, firing towards the player. Enemy ships break formation and swoop towards the bottom of the screen while firing, appearing once again at the top of the screen. The goal is to destroy all vessels on the screen to proceed to the next level. The player starts with three lives, and there are seven levels of difficulty.
title: Space Hawks

description:
Games Galore 1 is a compilation of four previously-unreleased games for the BBC Micro.

  • Fruit Tooty: A three-reel slot machine with options to nudge and hold. The player can gamble winning spins.
  • Fruit Worm: The player controls a worm that moves in the cardinal directions. Its tail elongates when it eats fruit, and must avoid eating vegetables. The player loses a life if they hit their tail or the wall.
  • Invasion Alert: A Space Invaders clone. The player starts with three lives.
  • Loony Lander: The player controls a spacecraft's left, right, and vertical thrust while gravity pulls the vessel down. The player tries to land on three progressively more difficult landing sites.
title: Games Galore 1

description:
Snake is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a snake that continuously moves forwards, and can be turned left or right in the cardinal directions. The snake gets longer as it eats red or purple snake segments. White snake segments offer bonus length. If the snake hits a wall, its tail, or green snake segments, it loses a life. The player starts with three lives. After collecting all items on a level, the player starts a more difficult stage.
title: Snake

description:
Reversi is a 1–2 player implementation of the popular board game for home computer systems.

The player competes against a human or computer opponent on an 8 x 8 board. The aim is to fill the board with as many pieces of their own color as possible by flanking the opponent's pieces to capture them and reverse their color. There are multiple levels of computer difficulty. Commands are via text input.
title: Reversi

description:
Hitch-Hiker is a text adventure based upon The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy.

Starting at the Five Artefacts Inn, the player must explore the Heart of Gold, the Restaurant at the End of the Universe, and a Vogon Battlecruiser in search of five special artifacts. The player meets several characters from the original story, and is helped in their quest by Eddie the computer. All commands are via text entry.
title: Hitch-Hiker

description:
Swarm is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship that moves across the bottom of the screen and fires up. Enemy ships swoop in circles and fire towards the top of the screen. Enemy eggs appear which, if not destroyed, will hatch into a large enemy vessel that moves laterally across the screen dropping bombs. If the large vessel reaches the bottom of the screen, it creates a hazard that temporarily prevents to player from moving over that location. The player starts with three lives.
title: Swarm

description:
Caterpillar is a 1-player Centipede clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a character that moves in all directions at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. A large caterpillar enters from the top of the screen moving laterally and, when it hits an obstacle, it moves down one row and reverses direction. When the player shoots a caterpillar, it breaks into multiple pieces that continue to move. When all caterpillar segments are destroyed, the player moves on to the next stage.

Mushrooms block the player's path, and a new mushroom appears when a caterpillar segment is hit. Spiders move across the bottom of the screen to threaten the player. The player starts with three lives.
title: Caterpillar

description:
Astro-Tracker is an Asteroids clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small spaceship that can rotate 360 degrees, thrust, and fire forwards. The ship can also hyperspace to random locations on the screen. Asteroids appear on the screen which, when hit, break into two smaller pieces, and then, four even-smaller pieces, until being entirely destroyed. New asteroids appear when all items on the screen are destroyed. Two types of alien UFOs appear. Some which fire towards the player, others which track towards the player to try to hit them. Small asteroids will also change direction and speed up.
title: Astro-Tracker

description:
Magic Eel is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a magic eel that travels in the cardinal directions. The player's goal is to eat all the yellow numbers from 1–7 on the screen, while avoiding the purple numbers, the edges of the screen, or the elongating tail of the snake. Whenever the player eats a number the tail gets longer. If the player touches any obstacle, it's game over. After completing the first level, the next ones have more numbers and additional barricades. One mistake and it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 2 has a Barricade in the Center

title: Magic Eel

description:
Cylon Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship that moves laterally along the bottom of the screen and shoots a large laser that instantly reaches the top of the screen when fired. A line of alien ships appear at the top of the screen while, one at a time, they drop towards the bottom while firing. The player gains points upon destroying an alien vessel, but loses points if the ship reaches the bottom of the screen. Ships reaching the bottom then appear again at the top. When all ships are destroyed the player enters a new stage, where every three stages the enemy ship color changes. The player starts with five lives.
title: Cylon Attack

description:
Games 3: Mindbender/Shapematch is a collection of games for the BBC Micro:

  • Mindbender: A Mastermind variant, where the player has 10 guesses to correctly determine a 1–10 column puzzle using the letters A–G. Each turn, the player is told how many letters are correct or are correct and in the correct position.
  • Shapematch: A tile-matching game where two players take turns flipping tiles on a 4 x 4 board trying to find matches.
title: Games 3: Mindbender/Shapematch

description:
Starfire is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player tries to destroy incoming enemy spacecraft by positioning them over the crosshair at the center of the screen, and then firing upon the enemy craft. There are three levels of gameplay difficulty, and the player has limited fuel and shielding to destroy enemy vessels. The game records the number of enemy ships destroyed.
title: Starfire

description:
Swarmers' Revenge is 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Tasked with protecting a section of the space wall from enemy threat, the player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. A large alien vessel drops towards the bottom of the screen, which carries a number of pods that hatch into swarmers.

The player tries to destroy all the swarmers on the screen while avoiding incoming enemy fire and large bombs which endanger a wider swath of the screen. If the player is hit, they lose a life. As enemy fire damages the bottom of the screen, a display bar at the bottom of the screen increases. If this fills the screen, it's instantly game over.
title: Swarmers' Revenge

description:
Snorter is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player attempts to destroy the snakes that appear on the screen, up to three at a time, before their energy runs out on each level. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and can push fence sections. If these fences are pushed into a snake it is destroyed. If the player is hit by a snake they lose a life. After every eight snakes destroyed, the player moves to a new level with a more challenging level design. The player has three lives at the beginning of the game.
title: Snorter

description:
Omega is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship that moves laterally and fires vertically towards the top of the screen. An enemy mothership travels across the screen and drops off two alien vessels. These aliens vessels rapidly move towards the bottom of the screen where they deposit bombs, and then begin to fire towards the player. The player must avoid these bombs and enemy fire while trying to destroy the vessel. When the enemies on the screen are destroyed a new mothership appears. The player starts with three lives.
title: Omega

description:
Fruit Machine and Honest Joe are two games released together for the BBC Micro.

  • Fruit Machine: A 3-reel slot machine where the player can hold or nudge. After a winning spin, the player can gamble or collect their earnings.
  • Honest Joe: A used car simulation where the player buys and sells cars to try to turn a profit. Allows 3–5 week games. The player purchases cars from customers by offering a price. If purchased, the car goes on the lot, and the sticker price can then be changed. Customers then enter the lot looking to buy, and the player tries to negotiate a selling price.
title: Fruit Machine and Honest Joe

description:
Alien Destroyer is a 1-player Space Invaders variant for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a spaceship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally left and right and fires vertically. A large group of alien vessels move horizontally to the edge of the screen, move down one row, and reverse direction. There are three large shields to protect the player from incoming alien fire. The player tries to destroy all enemy vessels before they reach the bottom of the screen. The player loses a life if hit by enemy fire. New walls appear every level. An alien mothership crosses at the top of the screen, and can be destroyed for bonus points. The player starts with three lives, and gains a new life every three levels.
title: Alien Destroyer

description:
Powerboat Racing is a 1–2 player arcade motorboat racing game for the BBC Micro.

Two players moving in opposite directions make laps in their motorboat around two moving buoys. The player's progress is documented in half-laps. The player moves in the cardinal directions from a top-own perspective. If the player strikes their opponent the race is over. The final score is calculated over three races.
title: Powerboat Racing

description:
Caterpillar is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Arnold the Caterpillar is trying to eat all the white lettuce on the screen. As he eats more lettuce he grows longer. If he touches his tail, the edge of the screen, or the red and green mushrooms, he loses a life. Each level has a bonus timer, and if the player eats enough lettuce before time runs out they receive bonus points. On screen 5 the player has a bonus level, where they try to eat as much lettuce as possible in 30 seconds. Starting on screen 6, an enemy caterpillar named Charlie appears, that the player must avoid while eating lettuce. The player starts with three lives.
title: Caterpillar

description:
Liberator is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Following an attack on the player's planetoid by mutant raiders, it is discovered that several hostages have been taken. Flying in a warp-ship, it is the player's duty to return the kidnapped citizens.

Played from a first-person perspective, the player moves a crosshair on the screen to shoot mutant power pyramids. In the first three stages, the player flies through flat plains, a mountain tunnel, and then a defended valley. Triangles and enemy creatures appear on the horizon. White and red ones can be shot for increased energy, but the player loses energy if they fail to shoot a red enemy. At the end of the third stage, the remaining energy can be used to save hostages. The player moves their ship left and right from a top down perspective in the fourth stage, and must avoid red triangles that approach from the bottom of the screen. When a hostage appears, the player can use their transport beam to rescue them.

After completing a hostage rescue mission, the player attempts the challenge again with more dangerous mutants.
title: Liberator

description:
Sleigh Bells is a 1-player Christmas-themed arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Wicked Jack Frost has stolen some of Santa's presents on Christmas Eve, and has taken them to a secret cave. As Santa's assistant, the player must avoid the dangers of the cavern and rescue Santa's presents.

Gameplay is divided into four parts. In the first section, the player must avoid the four snowmen guarding Jack Frost's cave by carefully maneuvering around them as they give chase. In the second section, the player must move through tunnels from the side view while avoiding falling icicles. The third section is similar to the second, but requires avoiding snowmen and bats. In the fourth section, the player tries to catch five falling presents and move them to the far right of the screen while avoiding a dangerous bat. The player starts with five lives. The final score is based upon the number of presents rescued.
title: Sleigh Bells

description:
The Sting is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player moves a bear on the screen to pick fruit and flowers while avoiding dangerous mushrooms. Fruit must be collected in the order they're displayed at the top of the screen. The player attempts to avoid a bee that moves randomly about the screen and will take a player's life if stung. Between each level is a bonus screen where the player tries to reach the teddy bear at the far right of the screen while avoiding mushrooms. Each level has progressively more fruit to try to collect.
title: The Sting

description:
Bandits is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small space ship that can rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, accelerate forwards, and also fire directly forwards. The ship can also jump to hyperspace, appearing randomly on the screen when in danger. The player tries to defend their oak trees at the bottom of the screen from large alien vessels that try to take them off the edge of the screen. Other alien vessels move about firing towards the player. Both ship types break into 4 dangerous sections when hit. When all oak trees are stolen, the alien ship type changes. These new ships rapidly fly directly towards the player in large groups. The game is over after the player has lost all lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: These Ships Head Straight at Me

title: Bandits

description:
Bouncing Bill is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls Bouncing Bill, who tries to reach the top of a series of moving platforms to pick fruit for his beloved damsel in distress. Bill can move left, right, or jump vertically. Balloons float up from the bottom of the screen, and these can be collected for bonus points. The player receives 5 points for moving up a level, but loses 10 points for falling down a level. Ghosts float down from the top of the screen. These cost the player a life if they touch or come near the player. The player also loses a life if they fall onto the bottom row of the screen.
title: Bouncing Bill

description:
Renegade Robots is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The planet is currently under threat of invasion. To counter this threat, scientists have invented a totally new weapon that is being guarded in a manufacturing plant staffed entirely by sophisticated robots. However, a series of explosions have caused the robots to violently spiral out of control.

The player controls a small character who moves in the cardinal directions in a room filled with crates. These crates can be pushed to trap and crush rampaging robots. A crate when pushed will move in that direction until it hits another crate or the edge of the screen, and then will be destroyed. Green robots chase the player through the maze, while purple robots will also push and destroy crates. At the start of each stage, the preview timer counts down indicating the time until robots start to appear. Only four robots appear on the screen at a time, but as they are destroyed more can take their place as displayed on the bottom of the screen. If the bonus timer reaches zero or all robots are destroyed, then the player moves on to the next stage.

Each level has an additional robot to contend with. Three special key cubes are present on each level. The player scores bonus points if these are used to destroy a robot, and these key cubes can not be destroyed. The player also can also score a large bonus if all 3 cubes are aligned, and an extra life if they are aligned with the flashing cube in the center. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Renegade Robots

description:
Looney Lifts is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player functions as the elevator manager at a fancy hotel. If management receive three complaints from the guests, then the player is going to be out of a job.

The hotel consists of 11 floors, and the player's job is to raise and lower the elevator to pick up guests one at a time and bring them to the bottom floor of the hotel. Because the guests don't like the player, if the elevator isn't waiting, the guests will run past the elevator and descend one floor on their own. Hotel doors will light up before new guests come out.

To make matters worse, the old hotel has developed holes in the floor and guests will fall down one level if they cross a hole. The player can make the guests jump to help them clear some holes. If a guests reaches the bottom floor without assistance they lodge a complaint.

Furthermore, luggage appears on the conveyor belt at the bottom of the screen. If the elevator is not waiting at the bottom when luggage reaches the end of the belt, then the player receives a complaint.

Special green VIP quests are worth 2,000 points, and yellow managers will reduce the complaint level if helped. Three complaints, and it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Luggage and a Hole in the Floor

title: Looney Lifts

description:
Billiards is a 2-player sports game for the BBC Micro.

Played from a top-down perspective, players position their shot by placing a cross on the screen indicating the direction of the shot. The player then selects the level of stop or backspin and speed or power of the shot. Player 1 uses a blue cue ball; Player 2 uses green. The player receives points for pocketing a red ball, pocketing a cue ball, in/off red, in/off other cue ball, and cannon. Three points are removed if the cue ball does not hit another ball.
title: Billiards

description:
Chemiplant is a strategy game for the BBC Micro.

The player takes on the role of manager of an astod plant, tasked with maintenance and repair of the plant, and meeting the needs of customers for astod. The goal is to retire after making a million dollars. The player purifies their astod by eliminating liquor. The player must also reduce and eliminate the waste product muckle, which can damage the plant.

Liquor is delivered to the plant by road tanker into the store tank. There, it is pumped into the reactor, where it is converted to astod and muckle with unprocessed liquor. Customers will only buy astod of certain purity. This mixture is then pumped to the still to be purified, and the astod is pumped to the stock tank, and the muckle is filtered off. Remaining product gets sent back to the store tank. If any tank overflows it backs up into the previous tank, or even onto the floor.

To control this process, the player modifies reactor volume and temperature as well as still bottom temperature and top flow. The player can also fill astod tanks, empty liquor tanks, or shut the whole plant down for the day if there is risk of major malfunction. If any of these processes become out of balance then alarms will be sent to the player. Alarms can indicate pump failure, overflowing tanks, high temperatures, or rubbish being made.

At the end of each day, the player has two minutes to process management options, including: cleaning equipment and changing processes, mending equipment, making some equipment bigger, checking market forecasts, financial reviews, or consultancy to help with other major issues.
title: Chemiplant

description:
Space Hi-way is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

As owner of a little fuel station just off a large intergalactic highway, the player must defend their station from deadbeat aliens who try to steal the player's fuel. The player controls their doublesupersaturatedphoton-plasmalasertransientalblaster base, which moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. The player tries to destroy waves of alien ships. Some of these rotate along the highway, with their position shown on the top of the screen, while others may exit off the highway and attempt to steal the player's fuel.

If the player shoots too quickly, their shot power decreases, which is displayed at the bottom of the screen. The player has limited fuel, and firing and movement decreases this. If fuel drops to zero the ship explodes. Fuel can be gathered by shooting the supports of fuel tanks, causing the tanks to fall to the bottom of the screen. If the fuel is shot, it's lost. If an enemy vessel reaches the bottom of the screen, it steals a large amount of fuel and turns into a rocket. This rocket blasts off and fires rapidly towards the player. Bonus lives are awarded every 10,000 points.
title: Space Hi-way

description:
Swamp Monsters is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

An alien swamp is invested with monsters, and the player controls a robot sent in to rid it of the infestation. The player moves across a number of stepping stones, and can pick up or replace the stones in the swamp. The goal is to defeat monsters by causing them to fall into holes.

Stones can be replaced, and some monsters will escape if stones are not quickly replaced on top of them. The robot sinks if it picks up more than two stones at a time or falls in a hole. The player has limited power to complete each level, and moving with stones also drains power. If the player stays in one place too long, they are eaten by a swamp monster. There are three levels of monster difficulty, and white monsters may become swamp monsters if they escape from the sinking swamp.
title: Swamp Monsters

description:
Invaders is a 1-player Space Invaders clone for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. Four large bases provide protection from enemy fire, but also block the player's shots. These get damaged when shot. Enemies move as a group laterally across the screen until they reach the edge, move down one row, and reverse direction. Enemies return fire at the player, and the player must destroy all enemies before they reach the bottom of the screen. UFOs move across the top of the screen which can be destroyed for bonus points. There are eight levels of game difficulty, and the player starts with three lives.
title: Invaders

description:
Hangman is a puzzle game for the BBC Mircro.

The player has 11 attempts to guess a word that is shown initially by blanks. Each successful guess is displayed, and each incorrect guess adds part of the image of a hanged man. If the player guesses wrong 11 times it's game over. There are three levels of difficulty, and 500 words in total to guess from.
title: Hangman

description:
Spaceguard is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player's spaceship is patrolling a sector of space where aliens are laying mines. The player's task is to destroy the aliens while avoiding collision with them and their mines.

The spaceship can move and fire forwards in eight separate directions. Aliens move about randomly, and release mines. Some alien ships explode when hit, and the explosion can destroy the player's craft. The player starts with three lives, and is awarded an additional ship every 10,000 points.
title: Spaceguard

description:
Crown of Mardan is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

In the Kingdom of Mardan, there was once a priceless gold crown set with three large stones. It possessed magic that gave the king who wore it and his heirs great wisdom and power. The Kingdom was peaceful and prosperous, except four evil Barons who were jealous of the King's power. When the old King died, the three Barons split the jewels amongst themselves, and the fourth took the crown itself. The player has pledged allegiance to the King, and must overcome the Barons to return the crown. Each of the crowns are now guarded by a ferocious dragon, which the player must outsmart to gain their prize.

The player must find money to buy items to complete their quest. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The player receives 250 points for each part of the crown retrieved.
title: Crown of Mardan

description:
The World Travel Game is a 1–2 player puzzle game for the BBC Micro.

Each player starts with £2,000, and must travel to various cities by plane, car, train, or bus to purchase souvenirs. Available locations in each city are arranged in rows, and every hour the player rolls a 1, 2, or 3 to land on these locations. They collect money every time they pass "Go". The player can visit the travel agent to plan their next trip, or the airport, station, or rental agency to travel. Local funds must be purchased at the exchange bureau, and souvenirs can be purchased at the gift shop. Each city has a limited number of souvenirs that can be purchased. The goal is collect as many souvenirs as possible in a limited number of days, or to purchase more than the other human opponent.
title: The World Travel Game

description:
Xanadu Adventure is a 1–2 player text adventure for the BBC Micro.

The game starts in the Adventure Shop, where the player can buy some basic inventory for their adventure. Then the player ventures out in search of treasure. The goal is to collect a total of 15 treasures from the dungeon, overworld, and castle, and bring them to the pagoda.

Along the way, the player must deal with dangerous dragons, dwarves, and limited flashlight power. The locations of items, treasure, and monsters are randomized throughout the adventure, with items appearing on the same region but not the same screen each game. The player risks breaking their weapons whenever they enter combat, requiring the player to backtrack and fix it.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Xanadu Adventure

description:
Escape from Orion is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player's spaceship has to make an emergency landing to pick up tools, water, fuel rods, and oxygen. The player can move left, right, climb up and down ladders, and jump. On each level the player has 800 time units to gather all six items and return to their spaceship The game is divided into four screens, the first with aliens that the player must jump over, the next has moving platforms, the third has conveyor belts and moving dangers, and the final screen has doors that open and close. The player starts with five lives, and gains a life every 2,000 points. If the player clears all four screens, they restart on a higher difficulty level.
title: Escape from Orion

description:
Katacombs is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

The player must explore a forest maze and underground catacombs in search of treasure. They must navigate a number of dangers to obtain a maximum score of 250 points. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Katacombs

description:
Games of Logic and Cunning is a collection of five educational games for the BBC Micro.

  • Auction: The player buys antiques by outbidding another player or the computer
  • Flip
  • Hexa15: 4 x 4 sliding block puzzle in hexadecimal
  • Reverse: Place a sequence of letters in alphabetical order by reversing sequences from the right-most letter chosen.
  • Telepathy
title: Games of Logic

description:
Missile Control is a 1-player Missile Command game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls three missile launch pads at the bottom of the screen, and attempts to protect six cities from incoming missiles. Missile aim is controlled by moving a crosshair. There are a limited number of missiles per silo per round. The goal is to destroy the incoming bombs. When all cities are eliminated, it's game over. The player receives bonus points for cities surviving after each round.
title: Missile Control

description:
Balloons is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small man who moves in the cardinal directions. Starting at the water at the bottom of the screen, his goal is to grab all the balloons located at the top of the screen, returning to the bottom with each balloon obtained. Every balloon grabbed causes the water to rise. The player must avoid a bouncing ball, weights that drop from the top of the screen, and moving to the top without hitting a balloon. The player has two minutes to complete a stage, and has a limited number of lives. There are four levels of difficulty.
title: Balloons

description:
Maze Man is a 1-player Pac-Man variant for the BBC Micro.

The player moves the Maze-Man around the maze trying to eat all the dots. The character must avoid the three ghosts who move constantly chase the player. A power pellet in each of the four corners temporarily makes the ghosts vulnerable. If the player touches a ghost they lose a life, and the player starts with three lives. If all dots are eaten the player starts a new identical level.
title: Maze Man

description:
Minefield is a puzzle game for the BBC Micro.

The player tries to move from the bottom left to the top right corner of a 10 x 10 minefield without stepping on any of the hidden mines. The player can move in four directions, and is armed with a mine detector that tells how many mines are in nearby locations. Mountains prevent movement. The player only has 20 moves before the batteries in their detector run out, forcing them to move blindly. There are nine levels of difficulty.
title: Minefield

description:
A Maze in Space is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Played from a side-perspective, the player can move in all directions, while alien dangers approach from the right of the screen. The player can shoot directly forwards and drop bombs, and must collect fuel to keep flying. The ship must avoid dangerous space mines and rockets, and will lose points if alien churches are destroyed. Guns or shields can become inoperative, increasing the dangers.

The player must first navigate through the many moons that lie in orbit to reach the planet surface. After that, the player enters a tunnel to the maze below where they search for the alien reactor that powers the planet.
title: A Maze in Space

description:
Zany Kong is a 1-player Donkey Kong clone for the BBC Micro.

The player must maneuver Morris along girders and ladders to save the maiden from Kong. In each frame, the player's goal is to move from the bottom of the screen to the top while avoiding a number of dangers before the bonus time reaches 0. The player starts with 3 lives.

In frame 1, the player must climb ladders and avoid barrels to reach the top of the screen. Hammers temporarily allow Morris to smash incoming dangers. Frame 2 adds conveyor belts, flaming oil, and ladders that move up and down as Kong moves left and right at the top of the screen. Frame 3 has vertically moving platforms, and the player must dodge bouncing springs. Finally on frame 4, the player must avoid fireballs to remove the bridges supporting Kong, causing him to fall to the ground.
title: Zany Kong

description:
Ski Slalom is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a skier who tries to navigate between 40 sets of flags from a side perspective. The player can move up and down as flags approach from the right, as well as a short distance forwards and backwards. If the player hits a flag, a snowball, or fails to go between flags, they're out of the race and lose a life. The player receives 50 points per flag passed, and gains a bonus score if they complete a level. Each level goes slightly faster.
title: Ski Slalom

description:
Galactic Wipeout is a 1-player arcade shooter for the BBC Micro.

It is the year 2200. The world is now diseased and over-populated. The only chance of survival is for the human race to move to a nearby galaxy, at present occupied by an evil force. A code 17 task has been assigned for a galactic wipeout.

The player controls a spaceship that can rotate 360 degrees, accelerate and fire directly forwards. Played from a top down perspective on a large field that scrolls and loops in all directions, the goal is to destroy all enemy vessels in a sector before proceeding to the next more difficult stage. All small map shows the player and enemy locations. The player starts with three lives, and gains a life every level cleared. When the player's ship is destroyed, all enemies currently on the screen are eradicated.

sample_screenshots.caption: All Parts Attack if the Center is Destroyed

title: Galactic Wipeout

description:
Snail Trail is a 1-player maze game for the BBC Micro.

The player tries to navigate their snail to the exit of a randomly-generated maze. The snail leaves a trail behind them, showing the path they took. The player has limited time to complete each maze, and gains bonus points for time remaining. There are four levels of maze size.
title: Snail Trail

description:
Plegaron People Eaters is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small character in a field filled with monsters and bricks. The player moves in the cardinal directions, while the monsters can move in eight directions. The monsters constantly move towards the player. The player pushes bricks, and tries to trap all monsters so they can't move. There are nine levels of difficulty, which influence the number of monsters on the screen.
title: Plegaron People Eaters

description:
Las Vegas is a 3-reel slot machine simulation for the BBC Micro.

Players can hold or nudge reels. There are options to gamble or collect winnings, and double or nothing on winnings.
title: Las Vegas

description:
Cosmos / Demolish / Task Force is a compilation of three previously unreleased games for the BBC Micro.

  • Cosmos: The player controls a spaceship that moves laterally on the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. The player tries to shoot and destroy a large alien swarm that moves back and forth at the top of the screen. To complicate this, enemy diving shielders sweep in from the edge of the screen and fire at the player. These ships always run straight towards the player.

  • Demolish: The player controls a laser gun that moves horizontally and fires vertically from the bottom of the screen. Trapped by a large red wall, the player must blast away the wall while avoiding falling bricks, radioactive particles, and mutated lifeforms.

  • Task Force: Each player controls five battleships separated by a large island at the beginning of the game. Each turn, all five battleships can move, and each player fires from a single ship each turn. Battleship firing is controlled by selecting an angle and firepower. If a ship is hit, it's sunk. Every few turns, both players fly a kamikaze plane from the corner of the screen. The two players move their planes simultaneously, and whichever player manages to hit a ship first sinks that vessel.
title: Cosmos / Demolish / Task Force

description:
Death 14 / Knockout / Space Raiders is a compilation of three previously unreleased games for the BBC Micro.

  • Death 14: The player has been caught spying on the planet Gloppleburger III, and has been sent to the death chambers. The player is hunted through the maze by arachnids and Otto, who continuously move towards the player. Otto takes three shots to defeat, and rearranges the maze as he moves. The player has limited ammo, and can pick up more in the maze. Every enemy destroyed causes a new one to appear in the corners of the maze. The goal is to survive until an exit appears, and leaving through it.

  • Knockout: The player controls a paddle laterally at the bottom of the screen, and bounces a ball to try to break the bricks at the top of the screen. The player starts with three lives, and it's game over if the player misses three times.

  • Space Raiders: The player controls a spaceship at the bottom of the screen that moves left and right, and fires vertically. The alien ships move as a group slowly towards the bottom of the screen, and drop large bombs towards the player. The player tries to destroy all ships to advance to the next level. If the player is hit once it's game over. Several small bases help protect the player.
title: Death 14 / Knockout / Space Raiders

description:
Crazy Cut / Klingon Attack / Mastermind is a compilation of three previously-released games for the BBC Micro.

  • Crazy Cut: A 1-player arcade game where the player moves their lawnmower in the cardinal directions. The goal is to mow as much of the lawn as possible before fuel runs out. Extra fuel can be picked up as the player mows. Running over rocks or cow patties can damage to the mower.

  • Klingon Attack: The player takes on the role of Captain of the Starship Enterprise, tasked with destroying a set number of Klingons in the galaxy. The entire galaxy is divided into an 8 x 8 block of 3 x 3 to 10 x 10 quadrants. The ship is armed with short range sensors to find Klingon vessels, stars, and starbases. Long-range sensors can detect the presence of enemies in nearby sectors.

  • Mastermind: A 1–9 player Mastermind variant, where the player tries to solve a 5 digit code that can contain 4–7 different colors. Each turn the player is told how many pieces are the correct color in the correct position, and how many are the correct color in the wrong position. The player gets 15 turns to solve the puzzle.
title: Crazy Cut / Klingon Attack / Mastermind

description:
Viper is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a snake that moves in the cardinal directions, and tries to pick up oak leaves on the ground. As the snake eats leaves, its tail grows longer and starts moving faster. The player tries to collect as many leaves as possible without touching their tail or running into the electrified walls of their cage.
title: Viper

description:
Croakit is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a frog who moves in the cardinal directions, trying to cross a busy street and river to reach the five open spaces at the top of the screen. The player has limited time to complete each run, and must avoid cars that run horizontally across the bottom of the screen. When crossing the river, the player must avoid alligators, submerging turtles, landing in water or falling off the edge of the screen. After five successful crossings, the player enters a new level with faster-moving dangers.
title: Croakit

description:
Valley of the Pharaohs is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

The player must explore an ancient Egyptian pyramid in search of treasures, bringing them back to the starting point outside the tomb. The player must take care to avoid ancient traps, mummies, and other dangers. Many areas have to be searched, sometimes repeatedly, to avoid dangers. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Valley of the Pharaohs

description:
Space Adventure One is a science fiction-themed text adventure for the BBC Micro.

It is several years since the Vaders of Vadros made their first attacks on the Galactic Federation of Planets. The Galactic Space Patrol has been successful, so far, in protecting the Inner Systems. However, reports indicate that the Vaders have now designed a dangerous new weapon. The player must attempt to thwart this attack by sneaking onto the planet Vadros. The goal is to find Vader headquarters, obtain the design of the weapon, obtain the attack plans, obtain a positronic brain, and return safely back to Patrol Headquarters.
title: Space Adventure One

description:
Star Trader is a 1-player science fiction-themed resource trading game for the BBC Micro.

The player is in command of an exploration starship. As a member of the Solaric Empire, it is the player's duty to get others to join either as members or as subjects. The ultimate goal is to obtain the advanced super computer from the Super Race, and bring it to the home world of Sol.

The player explores and trades through five star systems, each of which contains several planets. The galaxy is navigated by moving the player's position through a star map. Upon reaching a planet they must enter orbit, where they can trade, mine for fuel, or obtain other resources. The player must maintain repairs on their ship as well as keep fuel, food, water, and air supplies in stock. Friendly races can be asked to join the Solaric Empire, and the player can trade T-1 items, T-2 items, gem stones, and rare metals at these planets.
title: Star Trader

description:
Starforce Lander is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a space landing craft that can rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, and can apply thrust to move in the direction it is facing. Gravity continuously pulls the craft downwards. The player has limited fuel to make a successful landing on the landing pad on the screen, and must avoid dangers including asteroids and moving alien vessels. Horizontal and vertical velocity are displayed at the bottom of the screen. There are six different landing scenarios to challenge.
title: Starforce Lander

description:
Penguin is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a penguin, which must defeat the dangerous Snobees by smashing them under ice blocks. The player can move and kick blocks in the cardinal directions to defeat them. Snobees can also be killed by kicking the electric fence that surrounds the level to stun any nearby Snobees, and then kicking them. The Snobees can break down ice blocks and, if they touch the penguin, the player loses a life. When all Snobees in a stage are killed, the player moves to a more challenging stage. Each level has three special diamond ice blocks that the player receives a bonus if they are lined up.
title: Penguin

description:
Pharaoh's Curse is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player is an adventurer exploring a lost Egyptian tomb. The player must explore a horizontally-scrolling maze filled with deadly snakes that continuously spawn from select points within the maze. The player has a flashlight and bombs to defend themself. The flashlight only works horizontally, while bombs can be left for snakes to walk over and be destroyed. Only a single bomb can be deployed at a time. The goal is to gather the keys to unlock an exit door to the next level. There is limited time to complete each level, and the player starts with three lives.
title: Pharaoh's Curse

description:
Pontoon is a 1-player blackjack game for the BBC Micro.

Both the player and computer start with £1000 in cash. Each turn, the player can bet up to their maximum holdings. The player first draws their cards, with the goal of being as close to 21 as possible without going over. The computer then draws their cards, and the closest to 21 takes the pot.
title: Pontoon

description:
Hangman & Solitaire is a release containing the two games for the BBC Micro.

  • Hangman: The player has 10 attempts to guess a word that is shown initially by blanks. Each successful guess is displayed, and each incorrect guess or duplicate adds part of the image of a hanged man. If the player guesses wrong 10 times it's game over. There are three levels of difficulty, and 500 words in total to guess from.

  • Solitaire: A peg solitaire variant, where the player starts on standard English peg solitaire board, and tries to jump and remove pieces so that the final remaining piece is in the central hole. The computer is capable of showing a solution to the puzzle.
title: Hangman & Solitaire

description:
Wilfred the Warlock is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Wilfred moves laterally along the bottom of the screen, trying to protect his tower from birds who steal bricks from its walls. The birds fly in from the sides, grab bricks, and then try to fly off the side of the screen. Wilfred shoots vertically from his staff to defeat birds, but must avoid bird droppings. If a bird is carrying a block when hit, the block will stay on screen until the next bird comes. An evil creature moves laterally across the screen from side to side, and Wilfred must turn into a frog to avoid being hit. Wilfred can not fire while in frog mode. It's game over when all bricks are stolen or Wilfred is hit eight times.
title: Wilfred the Warlock

description:
Castle of Gems is a 1–2 player clone of Crystal Castles for the BBC Micro.

Bertie Bear is trying to collect as many gems as possible that are scattered around the castle. Played from an isometric perspective, the player must avoid the dangerous gem gobblers, trees, witches, ghosts, and gremlins that haunt the castle.

Both Bertie and some enemies can collect gems, and the player receives a bonus if they collect the last gem on the screen. When all gems are collected, the player moves to the next screen. The honey pot can be collected for bonus points, and the magic hat makes Bertie temporarily invincible. Lifts allow the player to move between different levels of the castle. The player starts with three lives, and can choose which screen to start the game.
title: Castle of Gems

description:
Castaway is a text adventure for the BBC Micro.

The player is marooned on a series of three islands, and must escape to safety. As the player explores, they encounter dangers including spiders, snakes, irate gardeners, and priggish chemistry teachers. There are graphics for multiple areas during the adventure. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and maximum score is 200 points. There is a save/restore feature.
title: Castaway

description:
Super Fruit is a 1-player slot machine for the BBC Micro.

Featuring a four-reel slot machine, the player starts with £2.00. The player has options to hold reels, swap reels, and nudge reels to try to increase their winnings. The bets are 10p a pull.
title: Super Fruit

description:
Classic Arcade Games is a collection of unlicensed BBC Micro versions of four classic arcade games.

  • Break-Out: The player bounces a ball off a moving paddle at the bottom of the screen, trying to break all the bricks. Each level, new bricks appear closer to the bottom of the screen. If the player misses a bounce they lose a ball, but gains a new ball every level completed.
  • Invaders: The player controls a spaceship laterally at the bottom of the screen, and tries to destroy enemy vessels that return fire. Three bases protect the player, and the aliens move as a group until they reach the edge of the screen, move downwards, and reverse direction.
  • Poc-Man: A Pac-Man clone, where the player must gobble dots in a maze while avoiding ghosts.
  • Tennis: 1–2 player game where players control paddles that move vertically at the lateral edges of the screen. The goal is to try to direct a bouncing ball into the opponent's net. There are five levels of computer difficulty and ball speed.
title: Classic Arcade Games

description:
Light Cycles is a 1-player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

Both the player and computer control a light cycle that moves in the cardinal directions, leaving behind a growing tail as it moves. The goal is to make the opposing player run into a light tail or the edge of the screen. The player can speed up or slow down their light cycle, and can also fire five times per match. If the opponent is hit, their current tail is removed from the playing field. It's game over when the player has been destroyed three times.
title: Light Cycles

description:
Scan is a 1-player card game for the BBC Micro.

The computer randomly lays out 25 cards consisting of hearts and diamonds from a 52-card deck face down in a 5 x 5 grid. The last card is discarded. The total value of all five cards is displayed vertically and horizontally. The player must use this information to infer the value of each card in the deck. The player then tries to lay their own cards in the same positions. If the player is correct they take the computer's card. The player receives a trick for getting five cards correct in a row, two tricks for also having the complementary suit, three tricks for a line of cards equal to the value of the computer's and, finally, four tricks for being the complementary suit. The player's final score is based upon the number of tricks received.
title: Scan

description:
Cosmic Intruders is a 1-player science fiction arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a small ship that moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. Enemy vessels appear at the top of the screen behind a barrier, and streak down one at a time towards the player from their barrier position. Ships are destroyed by shooting them, and the player loses a life if hit. Once all starting vessels are destroyed or reach the bottom of the screen, the remaining vessels appear again at the top. The player warps to a new stage with more enemy vessels when the previous stage cleared.
title: Cosmic Intruders

description:
Tank Attack is a 1–2 player arcade game for the BBC Micro.

The player controls a tank from a top-down perspective, which can spin clockwise or counterclockwise, fire forwards, and move in 8 different directions. The goal is to protect the six valuable supply containers in the center of the screen from enemy raids. Enemy tanks can dock with the supply tanks, and try to pull them off the screen. The player can also recover and move tanks that remain on the screen. Enemy tanks initially have no ammunition, but can return fire if they steal supplies. The player gains points for enemy tanks destroyed, and has an infinite number of tanks. It's game over when all supplies are lost. In two-player games, the players cooperate to protect the supplies.
title: Tank Attack

description:
Galactic Empire is a 1–4 player space-themed commodities trading game for the BBC Micro.

Over thousands of years, a vast empire grew until it filled the entire galaxy. This mighty empire is ruled by the much feared Council of Warlords. The warlords gain their power by controlling the few planets to contain rare energy minerals. To increase their power, the warlords constantly send their fleets of spaceships into battle. There is only one way to end the wars and secure a lasting peace. One warlord must defeat all the others and become emperor.

Each individual planet can create special weapons which can be used on enemy targets. The player can create coalitions with other systems. Individual planets have population size, growth rate, production dedication, and number of vessels stationed there. Planets are given ship construction commands, and vessels can be sent to attack enemy systems.
title: Galactic Empire

description:
Dodge'em is a 1-player Head-On variant for the BBC Micro.

Game play features two vehicles travelling in opposite directions on a four-ring circular track. The goal is to collect as many pellets as possible without coming in contact with the opponent vehicle. The opponent vehicle will always change lanes towards the player, and can move one lane per opening. The player can change one or two lanes per opening, and can accelerate or decelerate. Because shorter inside lanes take less time to traverse, the time between two vehicles passing remains variable. The player starts with three lives, and gains 10 points per pellet.
title: Dodge'em
